Kakuzu looked over at Asuma and tried to attack with his tendrils again, but Shikamaru quickly grew to ten feet and strengthened his hold on Kakuzu, a shadow hand racing up Kakuzu's body to his neck. Shikamaru held Kakuzu tight, breaking his neck. Kakuzu fell to the ground and Asumu and Shikamaru both took off heading back to the village.

When both ninja were gone, Kakuzu got his feet, straightening his neck. He still had a few hearts left and it would take more than breaking his neck to finish him off. He walked over to Hidan's body and lifted it up. He slung it over his shoulder along with his bounty and started looking for Hidan's head. He slowly made his way to the river where he saw something stuck to the side of the river on a tree branch. Getting closer, Kakuzu saw that it was Hidan's head, holding against the current by biting a branch that was hanging over the river. Kakuzu grabbed it by the hair and Hidan instantly started shouting, "It's about $%$#%%^ time!'

Kakuzu dropped Hidan's body and head and said, "Quit complaining. We're both still alive after all. I can still trade in this bounty."

Hidan snorted and said, "Yeah, but I want to get those two! They can't just treat me like this and get away with it! I'll $%$#%%^ kill 'em!"

Kakuzu rolled his eyes and pulled out a needle. He dropped Hidan's head onto his body and started sewing.

"Jeez! You're never careful with that damn needle!" Hidan complained. "It hurts like hell!"

Kakuzu said, "How many times have we done this? Just get used to it. Would you rather I left your head in the river?"

Hidan grumbled and said, "Just hurry up!"

As Kakuzu worked, Zetsu suddenly appeared out of the tree overhead.

"Looks like you ran into some trouble." Zetsu said.

"We were ambushed by Leaf shinobi." Kakuzu said. "One of them grew to about ten feet tall. Obviously Orochimaru was busy with those scrolls of his. This might be more difficult than we thought."

Zetsu nodded and said, "I'm going to go check on Deidara and Sasori. Stay here for now."

Zetsu quickly made his way through the ground, looking for Deidara and Sasori. It didn't take long to find them. Zetsu rose out of the ground and said, "I take it you two were ambushed as well?"

"How did you guess hmm?" Deidara asked, folding his arms.

"Kakuzu and Hidan were also ambushed. One of them was a giant as well. Orochimaru's jutsu must have lasting effects beyond what we thought."

"I'm not surprised." Sasori said, outside since his puppet had been destroyed by Kakashi. "Orochimaru's Forbidden Jutsu often have many effects, some of which he's unaware of."

"Anyway, they got the scroll from us." Deidara said.

"I'll go report to Pain about this." Zetsu said. "You two find Kakuzu and Hidan. They're about two miles East of here."

With that, Zetsu disappeared into the ground. Deidara sighed and said, "This was supposed to be an easy mission. What happened to that?"

"We didn't have as much information as we should have before trying to attack." Sasori said. "This is a somewhat unorganized mission."

"Well, we should probably try to find Hidan and Kakuzu hmm?"

"Of course."

The two ninjas started heading to where Hidan and Kakuzu were waiting.

As the Akatsuki started to regroup, Kakashi and Iruka and met up with Asuma and Shikamaru at the gate of the Leaf Village. Shikamaru shrank back down to normal size and said, "That's it right? We're done?"

"Yes." Kakashi said. "I'll deliver the scroll to the Hokage and report what we know about the Akatsuki members."

"Alright. I'm taking Asuma-sensei to the hospital." Shikamaru said.

Asuma grimaced and said, "I'm find Shikamaru. I don't need to go to the hospital."

Shikamaru suddenly grew to twenty feet and said, "Do you want me to carry you?"

Asuma knew he was beat. He sighed and said, "Fine, let's go to the hospital."

Shikamaru shrank back down to normal and said, "Glad you see it my way."

Iruka laughed as he watched Shikamaru and Asuma walk away. "Things sure are different now. I don't think I would've normally been assigned to a mission like this before. And Asuma is usually the one forcing Shikamaru to do things."

"Yeah." Kakashi said. "I think that despite the trouble we went through with Orochimaru and these scrolls, it all turned out for the better. Even Akatsuki seems like less of a threat."

Iruka stretched and said, "I think I'll go back to rebuilding the village. See you later Kakashi."

Kakashi lifted a hand in response and headed toward the Hokage's Mansion.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Defeat and Retreat

choices: Visit Asuma, Team 10 and Kurenia at the hospital
Visit Sasuke and other giants
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Tsunade looked over her desk at Kakashi. Sasori's scroll was on it between them. "I don't like you changing my orders mid-mission," she said quietly, "But it seems to of worked out for the best. Two Akatsuki were neutralized and one had a dangerous weapon destroyed. Based on your info on the puppet member, it sounds like Sasori of the Red Sand."

"I've never heard of him," Kakashi said.

"It's pretty ironic, you fighting him. Since out intelligence says your father killed his parents," Tsunade said.

"Well, that's interesting," Kakashi said, stiffening up. He still didn't like the mention of his father. "How are things going here?"

"Jiraiya went off to find his toad's remains," Tsunade said, "He was angry at one of them dying and feels partially to blame for the Akatsuki finding the scroll. He's also looking for Orochimaru's old hideouts to find and probably destroy his work."

"I see," Kakashi said, "And Naruto and Sasuke?"

"As far as I know, they haven't gone within 100 feet of the other," Tsunade said, "Sasuke helped finish the Ichiraku and is on to some other buildings. Naruto's been at Sakura's for a while now."

"Does anyone else know the genin giants are being watched by ANBU?" Kakashi asked.

"Only you, Shizune, and their senseis," Tsunade said, "Though all they're really doing is being watchers and messengers to me."

"True, I doubt even some of the strongest could stop one of us," Kakashi said. Tsunade raised an eyebrow when Kakashi separated himself and the other giants from the people of the Leaf.

"All right, I want you to stay on boarder patrol Kakashi," Tsunade said, "Don't grow unless needed."

"Understood," Kakashi said before disappearing. Tsunade looked at the scroll and opened it up. She had never gotten a chance to examine one. But before doing so, cut a piece of it off and put it in a sealed box so they'd have a scent to track Sasori by if needed. Tsunade went on to examine the untainted scroll in hopes of a way to make other ninja grow if need be.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Kakashi reports to Tsunade

choices: Iruka, wanting Naruto to work
Sasuke, who happened to be working nearby
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As Tsunade examined the mysterious scroll, Shizune was tending to Asuma in the hospital. He had rather severe burns down his right side since Kakuzu had singed him at close range. Shizune had cooled the burns using a special salve created from deer antlers from the Nara clan and then wrapped him up in bandages. Shizune sighed as she finished the room Asuma was staying in reeking of medicine. She turned to the door and opened it, letting Shikamaru, Ino, Choji, and Kurenai in to visit. Asuma smiled and said, "I didn't expect so many visitors."

"Is that all you can say lying there in your condition?!?!?" Ino shouted angrily looking like she wanted to punch her sensei.

"Hey, leave him alone Ino." Shikamaru said. "He's injured after all."

"That's my point! When are you going to learn to be more careful?!?"

"A ninjas' life is one of danger Ino, you know that." Asuma said.

"Yes, but that doesn't mean you have to take unnecessary risks Asuma." Kurenai said quietly.

Asuma sighed and said, "Fine, fine."

"I wouldn't worry about Asuma." Shizune said, drawing the attention of everyone in the room. "Though the burns were extensive you got him here fast enough to prevent any permanent damage. With a few sessions of intense ninjutsu healing, he'll be up and about again in no time."

Everyone sighed in relief at hearing this. Asuma tried to light a cigarette and said, "See? Everything is going to be alright."

Kurenai plucked the cigarette out and flung it out the open window. "No smoking until you're out of the hospital. Show some restraint Asuma."

Asuma groaned and said, "I'm injured! Why are you taking the one thing I enjoy away from me?"

Kurenai frowned and said, "You'd better be joking."

Asuma hastily said, "Of course I am! Come on, I thought it was obvious!"

Ino sighed in exasperation and said, "Come one you two. Now that we know Asuma-sensei is okay we have to get back to work!"

"You mean Choji and me have to get back to work!" Shikamaru said, earning a smack in the head from Ino.

Kurenai coughed and said, "I'd better be going as well. I'll see you later Asuma. Take care."

Asuma smiled and said, "Don't you worry about me. I'll be just fine."

Kurenai smiled and said, "You'd better be."

Asuma laid back down on his pillow and sighed, relaxing as he felt a dull throb coming from his burns. Shizune said, "Your first session will be in just an hour Asuma. That'll take away most of the pain and help you to relax."

Asuma pulled out another cigarette and said, "I've got plenty of ways to stay relaxed Shizune."

Shizune looked a little worried and said, "Just don't let anyone catch you doing that. I'll look away this once, but this is a hospital after all."

Asuma nodded and blew out a ring of smoke, watching it dissipate against the ceiling. "This is going to be a long few days..." He thought, drawing in on the cigarette.

As Asuma relaxed in the hospital, Shikamaru and Choji returned to work rebuilding the village. Not too far away from where the two genin were working, Sakura and Naruto were walking through the village, talking and enjoying the day. They passed by Shikamaru and Naruto called up, "Hey Shikamaru!"

Shikamaru looked down and saw Naruto. "Hey, you're finally awake?"

"Yup! And stronger than ever!" Naruto said, grinning.

"Well, how about using some of that strength to help rebuild the village?" Shikamaru said. "We've all been working our butts off for the last three days."

"Hmm..." Naruto said, with his arms behind his head. "Nah! I don't feel like it!"

Shikamaru sighed in exasperation and said, "Don't let the Hokage catch you lazing around or you'll get whipped into work so fast you won't believe it."

Naruto laughed and said, "Sure Shikamaru."

The pair left Shikamaru and Choji to their work and continued walking through the village.

"You know," Sakura said. "Maybe you should start working. I mean, even Kakashi and Iruka-sensei are rebuilding."

Naruto sighed and said, "But that kind of work is so boring! If I do any work I want it to be a mission!"

Sakura knew Naruto was going to say something like that. He hated doing any kind of chore, but he was all energy when it came to a mission.

"Well, I'm sure you're going to be getting a lot more missions now that you can become a giant." Sakura said.

As the two continued walking, they came upon someone in the road. Who was it?
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Some Rest, Some Work, Some Play

choices: Naruto stays as he is and may be rescued
Naruto grows to ten feet and crashes into Tsunade's office.  He's unharmed
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"Why? Why was it Naruto?! He's a fool! How could he of won against Kakashi? He beat me only when I was about to lose. He couldn't beat me in a normal bout." Sasuke thought these thoughts as he held up some wooden beams that were being nailed together.

"Thanks Sasuke," the carpenter said, "You can relax pressure." Sasuke let up. This had been his lofe for the past three days after being completely checked over. He hated feeling inferior to Naruto. Now the difference between them was extreme.

"I should of been the one to have that power," Sasuke mumbled as he looked down the street to a break area. As he gazed, his eyes narrowed. Naruto and Sakura were coming along. Sasuke walked towards them, at maximum height.

"Yeah I hope so," Naruto said in response to Sakura's reply, "And hope you can be with me on them." Sakura blushed and looked down the way.

"Naruto, let's take a side street," Sakura said quickly as Sasuke approached.

"Why?" Naruto asked, before looking down the street. He saw Sasuke and the look on his face. "Oh, no."

"Do you want to fight him?" Sakura asked as Sasuke came ever closer.

"No, but I won't run either," Naruto said. Sasuke finally came to a stop in front of them so they had to crane their necks back all the way just to see his face.

"Naruto, Sakura, you're in my way," Sasuke said. Sakura looked at Naruto, waiting for some response.

"Oh sorry Sasuke, we didn't see you there," Naruto said, moving to the side, "I hope you have a nice day." Sasuke grinned his teeth. He bent down and picked Naruto up by his collar.

"You really think you're better than me? You beat me in an unfair fight," Sasuke said quietly.

"Sasuke, let him go!" Sakura yelled.

"Unfair? You were the one who was corrupted at 20 feet," Naruto said, "If you had won, you would of gotten even worse. If you lost to Iruka, we all would of been screwed."

"And you knew you could handle it?" Sasuke asked.

"I swore I'd be Hokage. I had a reason to fight the control. You want power to defeat Itachi. Who do you think had the higher resolve?" Naruto asked. Sasuke began breathing deeply and quickly.

"Shut up," he yelled, "You aren't my better!"

"At normal size fighting, maybe, maybe not," Naruto said, "But in a test of wills, I am." Sasuke's hand began to shake. Without warning, he threw Naruto hard and fast at the Hokage's office.

"Naruto!" Sakura yelled, racing after the flying boy.

"Shit!" Sasuke thought at what he had done.

As Naruto flew through the sky, he thought on what to do. "Should I stay this size and hope for a rescue or grow and prevent damage?" he thought.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Sasuke's short fuse

choices: Naruto and Sasuke try working together
Pain has new orders for Sasori, Deidara, Hidan, and Kakuzu
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
With barely enough time to think, Naruto quickly increased his size until he reached ten feet. Just as he finished growing he smashed into Tsunade's office, shattering the window and splintering the frame. Before Naruto had crashed, Tsunade had been carefully examining Orochimaru's scroll to try and see how it worked. It was a delicate operation that was taking all her concentration. Needless to say she was surprised when Naruto suddenly crashed into her office, destroying the bookcase against the far wall, scattering paper everywhere, and reducing her desk to splinters. She surveyed all this damage her eye twitching until her gaze landed on Naruto, groaning and slowly getting to his feet. She snapped when she saw him, losing all of her patience in one go.

"NARUTO!!!!!" She screamed angrily.

Naruto jumped and guiltily turned to face Tsunade. "Uh...Hey Grandma Tsunade! What's up?"

"Don't give me any of that crap!" Tsunade shouted. "Just what the hell do you think you're doing anyway?!?!?"

"I was trying to make sure I wasn't killed when Sasuke threw me through the window!" Naruto explained.

Tsunade slapped a hand to her forehead and said, "You two are impossible! We have enough problems defending the village against a mass murdering organization and rival villages and nations without fighting amongst ourselves!"

Naruto crossed his arms and said, "Tell it to Sasuke! I was just walking with Sakura, minding my own business when he grabbed me!"

Tsunade rolled her eyes and said, "Yes, and I'm sure you couldn't have possibly have said anything to set him off could you have?"

Naruto avoided her gaze as he said, "Well...maybe...but he still started it!"

"Honestly you sound like an Academy Student! 'He started it!'. Just like a child! Is this the kind of example you want to set for the people of this village? You've been given an amazing gift through this ordeal and since getting your full power all you've done is fight with Sasuke!" Tsunade lectured.

Naruto felt pretty bad by this point. He knew it was wrong to constantly fight with Sasuke, but he couldn't just take his insults laying down either. On the other hand, he really hadn't done much work unlike the other giants. They were all much smaller than him, yet he was the only one not working. Tsunade started shifting the mountain of loose papers on the remains of her desk and said, "I think it's time you started working like everyone else. And as punishment for sending you crashing into my office I want you to work with Sasuke. And I mean just you and Sasuke! You both need to resolve your differences and quick! Sakura will be working in the hospital with Shizune in the meantime."

Naruto groaned and said, "Oh come on Grandma! Not Sasuke!"

Tsunade shoved a paper into Naruto's large hand and said, "Yes, with Sasuke! Now take this paper to Sasuke and both of you find some work to do. This is as good as a mission straight from the Hokage! If either of you disobey what is written on that scroll you'll both be severely punished!"

Naruto looked over the paper and saw that it was basically what Tsunade had just said, written down as a mission. Naruto sighed and said, "Fine, fine."

Tsunade watched him left and collapsed into her chair which had survived the impact. She rubbed her temples and muttered, "How could this day get any worse?"

She sighed and started looking for the scroll amongst the wreckage. After about five minutes she found it. In pieces. In all the commotion the scroll had been destroyed. It was in at least twenty different pieces, all the symbols wrecked.Tsunade saw a couple of specks of dust still on the scroll pieces and her heart started racing. She looked out the window and watched as the dust from Naruto's impact floated through the village. Scattered amongst the normal dust was, no doubt, growth dust from the scroll. Tsunade watched helplessly as the dust blew over the entire village.

"Oh crap..." she whispered to herself.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Problems, Problems, and More Problems

choices: Naruto and Sasuke, with Hinata stalking them
Sakura runs into Neji and Konohamaru, both were touched by the dust. . .
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Naruto walked back to where Sasuke was. As he departed the Hokage Mansion, Sasuke and Sakura arrived.

"Naruto, what happened?" Sakura asked, seeing some debris in his hair. Sasuke shrunk down to his old size.

"I almost landed on Granny Tsunade," Naruto said, "So, as punishment, Sasuke and I have to work together." Sasuke's eyes went wide. Sakura looked between the two guys.

"For how long?" Sasuke asked.

"Uhh," Naruto said, looking at the paper. He had forgotten to read that part. As he reached the part of the paper, "Until one of three things happens."

"And those would be?" Sasuke asked.

"'One, Jiraiya swears off peeping'," Naruto said before adding, "Not gonna happen. 'Two, I, Tsunade, give up drinking.' Also not gonna happen. 'Three, until I tell you two hot headed idiots otherwise. Now get to work or else. . .'"

"Or else what?" Sakura asked, slightly scared at how Naruto looked from reading the ultimatum. He gulped and handed it to Sasuke who quickly found what was written.

"We'll have to shovel out all the stables in the Land of Fire with out hands," Sasuke read, "She can't be serious, can she?"

"Yeah, she is," Naruto said, "I've never known her to break a promise."

"Well, I'll be there to help," Sakura said.

"No, you're on hospital duty with Shizune," Naruto said.

"What?" Sakura said.

"It's written in this order as well," Sasuke said, "Fine, let's get this over with."

"See ya later Sakura," Naruto said, as he and Sasuke walked off to another section of the village. Sakura was a little peeved at both of them for their stupidity earlier, but she still wanted to spend time with them, with Naruto. But an order was an order and she went to the hospital.

But team 7 wasn't the only one who heard this new order. Hinata had been buying some groceries when she saw the flying Naruto crash into Tsunade's office. She had hoped to approach him upon his leaving, but couldn't when Sasuke and Sakura approached. Now as she watched Sakura go off in the other direction, Hinata followed her crush as he and Sasuke went to work together.

Elsewhere, the dust that was scattered had a unique trait: it stuck together set masses. So as it floated over the village, it would slowly descend on two unsuspecting males before the next morning would come.

But which ones would we follow?
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: The orders given

choices: Konohamaru
Neji
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Sakura sighed as she walked down the street heading toward the hospital. She knew what Tsunade was trying to accomplish with this mission for Naruto and Sasuke, but she somehow didn't think that just forcing them to spend time with each other was going to help the situation any. This kind of thing just needed to get worked out on its own. Oh well. It wasn't like she could do anything about it anyway. She turned to corner and saw Konohamaru walking toward her, rubbing his hair for some reason. He saw her and said, "Hey! You're that forehead girl who hangs out with Naruto!"

Sakura glared at the boy and charged forward, punching him square in the gut, sending him to the ground. He gasped and managed to weakly ask, "What was that for?"

"You should respect a pretty young lady you jerk!" Sakura shouted, crossing her arms.

Konohamaru got to his feet and muttered, "First I get covered in dust and now this!"

Sakura ignored him, not hearing the part about the dust as she walked away. As Konohamaru turned the corner, adjusting his shirt, Sakura stopped and thought to herself, "Was he taller? Must be my imagination."

She pushed Konohamaru out of her mind and continued on her way to the hospital. She wondered what Sasuke and Naruto were doing now and how well they were getting along. As though on cue, a huge plume of dust (normal dust) appeared in the distance along with a very familiar yell of anger. Sakura sighed and said, "I knew this wasn't going to work."

"I take it you know what that was?" a voice suddenly asked.

Sakura turned and saw Neji coming out of a store, a bag in his hand. She smiled and said, "Naruto and Sasuke are supposed to be working together. They've always had a rocky relationship but this whole giant thing just made it worse."

Neji nodded and said, "I can't say I'm too pleased with it either. I missed the whole thing because I was on a mission. Enslavement doesn't sound like something I'd be interested in, but it all appears to have worked out to the advantage of those involved."

Sakura said, "I suppose. As long as no other enemies of the village get their hands on it then everything should work out."

Neji shifted the bag in his hand and said, "We can only hope. I've got to be going now. I have to take this home."

He walked away and Sakura turned back to the hospital. Everything seemed to finally be settling down. She walked into the hospital and turned to the front desk. "Excuse me, I'm supposed to be working with Shizune today."

The clerk smiled and said, "I'm sorry only authorized medical personnel are allowed to work in this hospital."

Sakura looked surprised and said, "But I was working in here just a few days ago!"

The clerk nodded and said, "Yes, but you were working with Lady Hokage. Unless you have some kind of proof that you're allowed to work here I can't let you get to where Shizune is."

Sakura sighed and said, "I do have proof, just not on me. I'll be back in a little bit."

She turned and left the building, running to where she remembered seeing the plume of dust. That's where Sasuke and Naruto were and that's where she'd get the paper proving she was aloud to work in the hospital. She was so focused on where she was going she failed to see someone turn the corner. She ran full tilt into them and was knocked down on her butt. After looking to see who she ran into she was shocked to see a giant standing over her. But it wasn't any of the giants she knew. It was a new one!

Who was it?
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Proof and a Problem

choices: Neji takes Sakura to Sasori, Konohamaru delays the two
Naruto and Sasuke catch up with the the two new giants
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"Konohamaru?!" Sakura yelled staring at the 6 foot tall academy student. Konohamaru looked down at Sakura.

"So, should I show you some respect now?" the giant asked, laughing. Sakura just took a deep breath so not to over react. But as Konohamaru reached down with a sadistic smile, Sakura was having trouble. Only when the boy fell to the side, did Sakura feel relived, for the moment. That is, until she saw her savior.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------

Elsewhere, on the other side of town, Naruto was glaring down at Sasuke. "You could of waited for me to get out of the way!" Naruto said. He knelt down from his 30 foot stature to Sasuke's 15 ft.

"You survived being thrown through a wall, I thought a building collapsing on you would be no problem," Sasuke said coolly. He looked at the rubble around them. Tsunade had assigned them to a demolition crew to take down old buildings. It was her plan for them to work out their anger on the buildings that would be coming down already.

"Right," Naruto said, "Look, we can't keep fighting forever. Why don't we just respect each other for the other's strengths?"

"You're joking, right?" Sasuke asked.

"No. You are smarter than me in terms of books, but I have a stronger will to keep my promises," Naruto said, shrinking to 15 feet tall and holding out his hand, "We make a good team. Always have, once we got past our differences before. Why don't we continue with that?" Sasuke looked at Naruto.

"Where the heck does he come up with these speeches?" Sasuke thought, "But he's right. We need to reform our friendship or we'll both suffer." But a sudden quake from another section of the village made them look.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----

Sakura looked at the giant that saved her. But she was still shocked at seeing Neji standing 12 feet tall.

"What was that for?" Konohamaru yelled.

“We need to leave her alive to use as bait,” Neji said as he grew again to 20 ft tall. Konohamaru also grew to 15 feet. Neji turned to Sakura and picked her up with ease. “Let’s get going. Master should be pleased,” Neji said before he grew to 30 feet tall and running off. Konohamaru grew as well and followed, crashing through a building.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----

"What the heck?!," Naruto said, staring where Sakura was. "Neji's huge with Sakura?!"

"I think this would be an excuse to stop this work," Sasuke said, watching as the two new giants run out of the village.

"Right," Naruto said, before they charged off.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Growing problems

choices: Sasori tests Neji's power while waiting for Zetsu
Sasuke reports to Tsunade as Konohamaru wakes up and escapes
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Naruto and Sasuke chased after the new giants and Sakura, eager to catch up with them and stop them. Neji glanced behind and saw the opposition coming. He turned to Konohamaru and said, "Stay behind and occupy them."

Konohamaru nodded and stopped, turning to face Naruto and Sasuke. Sasuke quickly grew to his full height of twenty feet while Naruto grew to match him. Konohamaru smirked and said, "I can do better!"

Both genin watched in surprise as Konohamaru grew bigger and bigger reaching fifty five feet in height! Naruto glanced at Sasuke and said, "You attack low, I'll attack high!'

Sasuke nodded as Naruto grew to match Konohamaru. Konohamaru looked surprised but quickly recovered and said, "If you want Sakura back you're going to have to go through me!"

Naruto answered with a quick, "Shadow Clone Jutsu!"

Instantly Konohamaru was surrounded by Naruto clones, some as big as Naruto, some as small as Sasuke, and a few in between. Konohamaru pulled out several kunai and tossed them at the clones, smiling as they exploded one by one into clouds. His smile quickly faded as he felt a burning sensation on his leg. He kicked out and knocked Sasuke back who had used a Fireball Jutsu on him. Even though Sasuke was more than a match for Konohamaru when they were normal size, the sheer size difference was all it took to reduce Sasuke from unbeatable opponent to mere annoyance. It wasn't a fact that was lost on Sasuke, but there was nothing that could be done about it. He threw out shuriken attached to strings and surround Konohamaru. Bringinig the strings together he sent fire down them searing Konohamaru from all sides. While Konohamaru was busy trying to avoid the fire, Naruto powered up a Rasengan and slammed it into the young boy's chest. Instantly he was thrown back slamming through building after building until he came to a stop about a hundred feet away. It didn't look like he was getting back up, but he wasn't shrinking either. Naruto had attained his size through Orochimaru's chakra while Konohamaru had got his through Sasori though neither of the two boys knew this. As such, Konohamaru was merely knocked out, but still a threat.

Not wasting any time, both Naruto and Sasuke searched for Neji, but he had disappeared with Sakura. Naruto smashed a building nearby angrily and said, "I can't believe we let him get away!"

Sasuke sighed and said, "Well there's nothing we can do about it right now. We should report this to the Hokage."

Naruto shrunk back down to his normal size and said, "Yeah, Grandma Tsunade will probably want to know about this."

Sasuke grabbed Naruto's arm as he started walking toward the Hokage Mansion. "What are you doing Sasuke?"

"One of us needs to stay here and watch Konohamaru in case he wakes up. You can get a lot bigger than I can and you may need to. Just because he only grew up to fifty five feet now doesn't mean he can't get bigger."

Naruto nodded and said, "I sure hope neither of them can get too much bigger."

With that, Naruto ran over to Konohamaru's unconscious body. He looked at the burn marks and the spiral mark on his chest where the Rasengan had hit and felt bad. He knew that Konohamaru couldn't help himself and was being forced to fight against his will, but that didn't mean it was right to hurt him so much. Hopefully they'd be able to keep him under control and they wouldn't have to fight anymore.

As Sasuke made his way to the Hokage Mansion, Neji, Sakura in hand, was making his way to Sasori and Deidara who had found Hidan and Kakuzu and were waiting for Zetsu to return. Hidan glared at Kakuzu and said, "You just had to bring a corpse with you on this mission didn't you?"

Kakuzu sighed and said, "I didn't bring this on the mission. I killed him ON the mission."

"Yeah, well it's starting to @#$%&* smell!" Hidan shouted.

Sasori quickly broke in and said, "Stop it. The last thing we need now is you two fighting. Again."

Kakuzu turned to Sasori and said, "Well it's not like it can get any worse."

As he said this, Neji came crashing through the trees, stopping in front of the four Akatsuki members. Deidara turned to Kakuzu and said, "You had to say something didn't you, hmm?"

Neji simply lowered Sakura to the ground who fell to her knees, weak after the frightening journey. After setting Sakura down, Neji crossed his arms and said, "What is your order master?"

Deidara looked from Neji to Sasori before asking, "Do you know this giant ninja Sasori-sama?"

Sasori shook his head and said, "It looks like the Konohagakure ninja somehow lost control of the scroll they stole from us. Its worked in our favor though."

Kakuzu smiled and said, "Looks like you don't have to do any work after all Hidan."

Hidan shrugged and said, "Whatever. It didn't really matter to me anyway."

Deidara said, "What are you going to have him do Sasori-sama?"

Sasori thought about and said, "I'm not sure yet. Perhaps we should wait for Zetsu to return."

"Why bother?" Hidan said. "We have a great weapon right here!"

Kakuzu snorted and said, "Yes and how many giants does the Leaf Ninja have? With only one we wouldn't stand a chance."

Deidara shrugged and said, "I don't know. We should at least find out what we can do with this one. Maybe there's more than one."

Sasori nodded and said, "Very well. We'll test this ninjas' power while we wait for Zetsu."

Sakura just watched all this in horror. She was trapped, hoping that Naruto or Sasuke or anyone could come and save her. She didn't know why Neji had brought her here since the red haired ninja (Sasori she thought they had said) hadn't given him any orders. What was going to happen next?
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: One Stopped, One Escaped

choices: Konohamaru arrives and sees a 120 tall Neji
Sasori is making a new scroll to make more slaves
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Tsunade stared out from the large hole in her office wall, having seen what just happened.

"It looks like that dust found some new hosts. But why didn't Naruto grow from beating Konohamaru? Unless they can only grow from dust of the same maker," Tsunade said quietly to herself. Suddenly, Sasuke appeared outside the hole.

"Lady Hokage, Neji and. . ." Sasuke started.

"Shut up. I saw the whole thing," Tsunade said, her gave turned to the 6 foot ninja before her.

"And they took Sakura as well," Sasuke said. Tsunade looked at Sasuke.

"Well, that explains why Naruto and Sasuke went after Neji and the boy," Tsunade thought. "Ironic," Tsunade said.

"What is?" Sasuke said.

"This entire situation is your and Naruto's fault," Tsunade said.

"What do you mean?" Sasuke asked. He could understand the escape part as they were too focused on Konohamaru, but everything?

"The dust that made them grow came from a scroll Kakashi retrieved from the Akatsuki. I was examining it when you sent Naruto to me earlier. As a result of Naruto's entrance, the scroll was destroyed and the dust released. So, this is your fault." Sasuke gulped.

"Well, isn't this an interesting turn of events," came a voice from behind both of them. Tsunade turned and saw Jiraiya looking grim.

"You found the toad I take it?" Tsunade asked.

"Its remains. Something ate it and spit it up," Jiraiya said, "And now we have two more rouge ninja giants? What a week." Tsunade closed her eyes. She knew they had to get Neji and Konohamaru back to normal. They also had to stop them from meeting up with their master. Obviously, this master was different from Orochimaru, seeing as Neji and Konohamaru worked together verses fighting. But with a different master, they couldn't be shrunk by victory from any of the good giants.

"Jiraiya, I want you to lead the rescue mission," Tsunade said, "But first, get Shizune. we'll need to fix Konohamaru."

"Right," Jiraiya said before disappearing. Tsunade glared at Sasuke before running off to where Naruto was.

---------------------------------------------

Naruto stood at 200 feet tall, pressing down on the now 70 feet tall Konohamaru.

"Man, why did this have to happen?" Naruto thought before he saw this prisoner wake up.

"Huh, Naruto? What happened? Why am I huge?" the boy asked.

"What? You don't remember?" Naruto asked.

"No, I just remember walking past your girlfriend, then waking up here," Konohamaru said. Naruto wasn't sure whether to believe him or not. But Konohamaru suddenly grew ten feet and Naruto's lacking hold was broken before he could get another hold. Konohamaru raced from beneath the mammoth Naruto. Naruto only holding the remains of the boy's scarf. He was about to give chase when he felt some pressure on his toe. He looked down and saw Tsunade and Sasuke below.

Tsunade watched as Naruto shrunk to 8 feet tall. "Naruto, you idiot! Why did you let him escape?!" Tsunade yelled.

"Well, he started acting normal and couldn't remember what happened. The others turned normal after being beat, so I wasn't sure," Naruto confessed, "But I did grab his scarf so we could track him with Kakashi-sensei." Tsunade and Sasuke looked at Naruto. Both could see him being tricked the first time, seeing as they wouldn't of been sure themselves. But both saw the second part as an accident. But someting caught Tsunade's eye.

"Let me see the scarf," Tsunade said. Naruto handed it over. It was fine,and not much left, but it was there: Sasori's dust. Suddenly Kakashi, Jiraiya, Shizune, and Maito Guy appeared.

"Oh my precious Neji, what happened to you?" Guy yelled. Tsunade looked at the assembled.

"Three can't grow, but of them, Shizune and Jiraiya will be needed. Guy can't do much to help. Kakashi and Naruto will probably be needed. Sasuke won't want to be left out. This will be trouble," Tsunade thought. "All right, we'll follow them with Konohamaru's scent. I'm going to be examining the dust, so Shizune, I'll need you to go with them to operate on the two giants and Jiraiya to seal it. Kakashi will lead and Naruto will assist. Sasuke, though you're the smallest of the three, you're also one of the fastest. You're objective will be to get Sakura out of there. Everyone else, subdue those two giants," Tsunade said.

"What about me?" Guy asked.

"You can't grow. You'd most likely be a hazard to the team," Tsunade said coldly. "Now get going!" Tsunade said as Kakashi picked up some tattered remains of Konohamaru's clothing. He summoned Pankun and they were on their way.

Meanwhile, with some extrasensory radar, Konohamaru knew exactly where to find his master and ran that way.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Outwitting the fox

choices: Kakashi and the others find Sasori
Deidara, Hidan, and Kakuzu find suitable ninja to make giants
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As the other ninjas mobilized, Sasori was busy making more scrolls to create more slaves with. Deidara, Kakuzu, and Hidan were standing guard around him while Neji kept a long distance lookout using his Byakugan to help. Deidara, being the closest to Sasori, asked, "How many scrolls are you making Sasori-sama?"

Sasori, his concentration focused completely on the scrolls, said, "Only three. There's no point in overdoing it right now. This jutsu is a lot more draining than I had anticipated. I won't be of much help in a fight after this so it'll up to you three to protect me."

Deidara smiled and said, "What about the big guy, hmm? Personally I think he'll be of more help than those other two."

"Be glad they can't hear you say that." Sasori said, sealing the last scroll. "They'll be fighting all over again if they could."

Sasori stood up with all three scrolls, his breathing ragged. He tossed one to Deidara and said, "The Leaf Shinobi aren't going to take this situation lightly. I believe they'll come looking for us again. That's why you, Kakuzu, and Hidan are going to take these scrolls and use them to make three more giants. It can by any shinobi of your choosing. No matter who it is, they'll fall under my control. If worse comes to worse, try using the scroll on one of the smaller giants that Orochimaru created. Normally the two forces, Orochimaru's and my own, would clash and the jutsu would be useless. However, if some of the giants changed very little from Orochimaru, then my jutsu should override his and put them under my control."

Deidara sighed and said, "This is becoming more and more complicated as time goes on."

"Don't complain." Sasori said coldly. "Just hurry up and do your mission."

Deidara nodded and left, heading toward the Leaf Village. He started running through names in his head, wondering who to use the scroll on. "No kids." He thought. "They won't have enough skill to contend with the likes of Kakashi. And definitely not that Maito Guy person. He's way to annoying even if he's on our side. Hmm...Who should I choose?"

As Deidara headed toward the village, Sasori handed out the other scrolls to Kakuzu and Hidan with the same instructions as Deidara. After they both left Sasori sat on the ground, his body weak after using the Forbidden Jutsu so many times. Before he had time to take more than a few breaths, however, Neji said, "Someone's coming."

Sasori quickly said, "Then get ready to fight them. If you're overwhelmed, then escape immediately with me."

Neji nodded and crouched into a fighting stance. Luckily for them, it was nothing to worry about. Konohamaru came charging into the clearing at ten feet tall, small enough not to be seen, but big enough to move fast. He stopped in front of Sasori and said, "I managed to escape master."

Sasori frowned and said, "A kid eh? Better then nothing I suppose. Hyuga boy. When the other Leaf ninja arrive, fight them but don't worry about escaping. The boy will help me get away if things look grim."

Both boys nodded and started growing, Neji to a fighting size, and Konohamaru to an escaping size. Sasori recovered enough to throw out a few chakra strings and attach them to Konohamaru. The boy was going to be able to put up a fight only if Sasori controlled him. Neji would fair well on his own. Now there was nothing left to do, but wait.

Sakura, hidden from sight, was bound and gagged by Sasori. They were going to keep her as insurance in the coming fight. If need be, they'd use her as a human shield to escape. The other ninja wouldn't dare hurt a comrade.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Preparing for an Attack

choices: Sasori escapes with Konohamaru and Sakura, Neji's caught and healed
They get Sakura back, and Sasori must retreat/ someone new grown with a sroll
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Back at the Leaf Village, Shikamaru and Iruka were informed of what happened with Neji and Konohamaru.

"So I want you two to lead defensive groups around the perimeter of the village," Tsunade instructed, "We need to make sure no one else succumbs to being a slave giant."

"It was better when Oroshimaru was in control," Shikamaru said, "At least then we didn't go kidnapping people. We just fought each other."

"Drop it," Iruka said, "This is a big deal. You go get Rock Lee and Choji and take the west half of the village. I'll take Shino and go east." Iruka didn't like the possibility of fighting his old students. But he didn't have much of a choice in the matter.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------

Back with the rescue team, Naruto and Sasuke stood close to 6 feet tall, so they could keep up easily with the adults.

"And that's the move I made up," Naruto said, speaking of his size changing tackle. Kakashi blinked.

"Only Naruto would come up with that. But as long as Neji and Konohamaru are growing and dangerous, it might be useful," Kakashi thought. Shizune looked on.

"I know I can do this,' she thought.

"Kakashi, we're nearing them," Pankun said.

"Right, Sasuke, hold up for a minute," Kakashi said.

"What for?" Sasuke asked as they stopped.

"Simple, I'm going to hide in your shadow," Jiraiya said.

"What?" Sasuke said.

"Look, doing this will make us seem weaker than we are," Kakashi said, as Jiraiya preformed the jutsu, "And if Neji and Konohamaru retain their memories of the past few days, both will know Naruto's and my top reaching sizes. So we'll need an ace in the hole."

"Fine," Sasuke said before they started moving again. They moved at their fastest speeds, but once they got in Neji's vision ragne, that speed was less effective.

"Four Leaf ninja are coming," Neji said, "Kakashi, Naruto, Uchiha Sasuke, and a medical ninja."

"And the others?" Sasori asked.

"They're taking a longer way around and not following the paths Konohamaru and I made," Neji said.

"Get ready then," Sasori commanded. Both slaves took fighting positions. Neji was now closing in on 100 feet tall. He doubted any strike could pierce him.

As Naruto took the lead, he made a massive amount of Shadow clones and threw them the giant Neji. Neji prepared to defend when all of the clones grew to massive size and landed on Neji, overwhelming him.

Sasori watched the attack. "Boy, watch the back," Sasori said, realizing the similarity to the attack before. But it was too late, and Sasuke came from the back woods. Konohamaru readied to attack when Jiraiya came from Sasuke's shadow and summoned a toad to attack Konohamaru, while Sasuke looked for Sakura.

As Neji fended off the last Naruto, who were all clones, he stood looking Kakashi at eye level. In a moment, Kakshi used his sharigan on Neji to slow him down.

The real Naruto was staying with Shizune to protect and wait for sasuke to get back with Sakura.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: A titanic battle

choices: Sasori uses the scroll on Konohamaru and waits for the others to return
The Akatsuki members run into the perimeter guard (uses the scroll?)
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Sasori knew when he was beat. He had no idea the Leaf shinobi would launch such a ruthless attack from all sides. It was a miscalculation on Sasori's part and one he would now have to deal with. He twitched his fingers and Konohamaru ran over to him, picking him up. With his other hand, Sasori shot out more chakra strings that attached to Sakura and pulled her out of her hiding spot and into Sasori's grasp. Directing the one hundred foot tall Konohamaru, Sasori punted Sasuke out of the way, the size difference once again canceling any need for finesse or planning, and escaped as fast as he could, the giant toad giving chase. Neji, however, wasn't so lucky. After dealing with the Naruto clones and getting caught in Kakashi's Sharingan there wasn't much left to do except try to escape. Unfortunately, with Konohamaru being left to the toad, every ninja present was focusing on Neji. Within seconds, attacks rained down from both sides, Naruto with his Shadow Clones, Sasuke was fire techniques, Shizune with poison gas, and Kakashi with regular close quarters combat. While Neji was getting pummeled, Jiraiya was drawing out a sealing scroll, ready to catch Sasori's chakra when the healing began. After a few more minutes of ceaseless pounding on Neji, Naruto was able to use Shadow Clones to pin him down while Shizune was lifted onto his chest to perform the healing jutsu. It was difficult, but she drew on Sasuke's chakra to finish the operation, hunting down and pulling out all of Sasori's chakra. Though it was powerful, his chakra did not contain the same poisonous malevolence that Orochimaru's had. Jiraiya caught the chakra in his scroll and sealed it up, stowing it in a bag separate from the one he was using to hold the scrolls of Orochimaru's chakra. Everyone breathed a sigh of relief as Neji shrunk back down to his normal size, unconscious.

Naruto looked around in the aftermath of the battle and said, "Crap! That other guy got away with Sakura and Konohamaru!"

Jiraiya smiled at him and said, "Hey, don't worry about them! I sent a toad after him so he'll be coming back in a little bit."

As though on cue, the toad returned to Jiraiya's side. Jiraiya yelled up to it, "Alright, did you get him?"

The toad croaked and shook his head. Apparently Konohamaru had gotten away. Jiraiya swore loudly. "I underestimated him."

"Well there's nothing we can do about it now." Kakashi said. "Let's take Neji back to the hospital and report to the Hokage."

Naruto was reluctant with this plan. He wanted to chase that guy down now and get his friends back. But he was pretty worn out by his fight with Neji and he wanted to make sure he was going to be okay too. So the group left, ready to track down Sasori again when they were better prepared.

As the Leaf ninja made their way back to the village, Konohamaru had stopped running and set Sasori and Sakura down in a large clearing, far enough away from the village to be safe. Sasori was almost fully recovered and pulled out a scroll. He had been defeated soundly and was now down one servant. Even if Deidara, Hidan, and Kakuzu made more, they wouldn't be enough. The Leaf Village had too many giants on their side. The only way to tilt things back into the Akatsuki's favor would be to make whatever servants he had now, bigger and stronger. It didn't help that his bodyguard was a mere Academy Student with barely any jutsu.

"That won't matter though." Sasori said to himself as he finished drawing the last symbols on the scroll. "After he gets this dose of power, no one will be able to match him in size or strength."

Sakura's heart was pounding as she watched Sasori work. This was starting to look very, very bad. It was bad enough having only Orochimaru to worry about. Now they had to try and keep track of at least three people. And she knew there were more members in Akatsuki. The only question was where exactly were they?
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Sasori's Plan

choices: Neji makes a full recovery and the Akatsuki go after Kankuro
Something's off with Neji / Sakura makes a break for it from her captors
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
A bird flew high above the Leaf Village and a blond ninja watched the giants move below. "Not good , hmm," Deidara said before returning to the other two.

"So, what the f%#$ situation?" Hidan asked,still peeved about Asuma's actions from earlier.

"There are at least five giants keeping watch over the village from attack," Deidara said, "I doubt we could get in and find a suitable candidate before they come at us. Hmm."

"So we should return to Sasori and use these on his current slave," Kazuku said.

"What are you guys, chicken?" Hidan asked as he started walking to the village. But he didn't ger far as Kazuku ripped his head off Hidan's body.

"You need to pay attention. I'm going in on this gambit," Kazuku said, "And you may be immortal, but you're pretty useless like this." As he spoke, Deidara had his bird pick up Hidan's body.

"I'm going to kill you you bastard!" Hidan yelled as the other two started to go back to Sasori.

"You know, my target in Suna has a brother," Deidara said, "We could use him."

"And they wouldn't have any giants there," Kakuzu said.

"All right, we'll go there," Hidan said.

As the three Akatsuki went back to meet Sasori, they passed the Leaf Ninja by a mile.

"So Neji got to 120 feet tall," Jiraiya said, riding on a 20 foot Kakashi's shoulder. Sasuke was carrying Shizune, while Naruto carried Neji. "That will be useful."

"Yeah," Sasuke said, miffed that he wasn't able to save Sakura. The five ninja moved quickly back to the village and soon made it.

Back at Sasori and Sakura, Konohamaru grinned. He held the scroll his master gave him. "With this power, people will no longer see me just as the the honorable grandson," Konohamaru said opening the scroll and the dust came at him. He quickly shot up in height to 160 feet tall.

"Very good slave," Sasori said, looking his living puppet over.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: A new target

choices: Kankuro joins Sasori
Tsunade continues to examine the dust from where she left off
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Deidara, Kakuzu, and Hidan quickly made their way to the Sand Village, Deidara riding on his clay bird with Hidan's body while Kakuzu ran underneath him clutching Hidan's curse spouting head. Eventually Kakuzu got sick of listening to Hidan yell and sewed his mouth shut. After a few hours of travel the Sand Village was finally in sight. Deidara landed next to Kakuzu and said, "Alright hand me your scrolls. I'm going to find the target and seal the scrolls into three low level bombs. I'll set the bombs off around the target and he'll get covered in the dust. He'll no doubt then seek out Sasori and we'll have three giants on our side."

Deidara counted Neji not yet knowing he was being healed as he spoke. But Kakuzu nodded and handed over the two scrolls he had. He brought Hidan's body over to his head, which he had just dropped on the ground, and said, "I'll start sewing Hidan back together. Don't be gone too long or I can't guarantee Hidan will be whole when you come back."

Deidara rolled his eyes and said, "I'll keep that in mind."

He jumped back onto the clay bird and flew it up high into the sky over the village readying the bombs and searching for Kankuro. It didn't take as long as Deidara would've thought. He was dressed in the casual wear of the Sand Village and without the usual markings on his face since he wasn't currently on a mission. Focusing in on him, Deidara saw that he was buying maintenance tools and spare parts. Deidara remembered that he was a Pupper Master and was no doubt buying these items to help repair his puppets.

"He's using Sasori-sama's puppets if I remember correctly." Deidara thought. "Mere toys compared with Sasori-sama's latest work."

Deidara swooped around and hovered when he was over Kankuro. Taking careful aim, he dropped the bombs around him. Deidara watched as Kankuro stopped in his tracks as he saw the bombs fall around him, exploding on impact. The dust burst free from the destroyed scrolls and gravitated toward the nearest male which was Kankuro, covering him in three full scrolls of growth dust. Deidara grinned and said, "Bulls eye!"

Kankuro coughed and looked around wildly, wondering where that attack had come from. He cursed himself for not bringing his puppets along with him. He wasn't expecting to get attacked while on a quick trip to pick up parts for Crow. All these thoughts were wiped away as his body slowly started to grow. As he passed ten feet in height, his clothes getting incredibly tight on his body, his mind had only one thought: Get to Master Sasori.

With that thought in mind, and still growing, Kankuro headed to Sasori and Konohamaru.

As Kankuro started his journey, with Deidara, Hidan, and Kakuzu in pursuit, Neji was starting to awaken from his healing sleep. His eyes opened to find himself surrounded by ninja all looking ready to attack. He said, "What's going on?"

Shizune approached slowly and said, "How are you feeling?"

Neji looked at Shizune and said, "I'm feeling fine. Can someone please tell me what's going on?"

Everyone in the room breathed a sigh of relief and Shizune said, "Don't worry about it Neji. I'll explain everything while I perform your post op check up."
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Lose One Slave, Gain Another

choices: A 200 ft Kankuro arrives at Sasori / Gaara returns to the village
Tsunade attempts to make a growth scroll and tries it out on someone
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As Shizune explained what happened on the last mission, the memories slowly came back to Neji. With each sentence, he became angrier and angrier that he had been so controled so easily.

"I'm weak!" Neji said, "None of the other giants lost themselves that quickly."

"It was a different user from Orochimaru," Shizune said, "He had different motives in making the scroll. He was a puppet master after all. He must of had an intent to control his minions to a high degree. That's much different from Orochimaru who wanted a single warrior."

"I guess," Neji said when suddenly the door opened and his two team mates came in.

"Neji, you're all right," Tenten said happily, "Um, how tall did you grow to?"

"I'm not sure," Neji said.

"I think in the low 100's," Shizune said, "And if the affects are the same, you'll be able to again."

"Oh how I hate this! How unfair!" Lee said. For the first time, he had been able to beat Neji, but now the odds were slim once again. Neji just shook his head and laid back.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------

Tsunade was in her second office, as the first was being fixed, still examining the tainted dust. "Similar in make, but has different attributes. It's also far more crude," Tsunade said, comparing the two dusts, "It is on a set growth from a single dosage, based on the original height. It also lacks transference properties, which explains the lack of absorbing on the victor's part." There was a knock at the door and Tsunade looked up, seeing Jiraiya. "Don't come any closer," Tsunade said.

"Wasn't planning on it," Jiraiya said, "I just thought you'd want my two cents."

"And that would be?" Tsunade asked.

"If the Akatsuki wanted more giant slaves, they'd probably come here," Jiraiya said, "But if they didn't want a run in with the boarder patrol, they'd retreat and go elsewhere."

"You're point?" Tsunade asked.

"A message from Suna," Jiraiya said, tossing the scroll to Tsunade, "It seems they now have two giants. Gaara and his brother. They're requesting help in retrieving him. Gaara, his sister and their sensie are on their way here now."

"Wonderful," Tsunade said, "Now they're back to two giants."

"It gets better," Jiraiya said, "They found the remains of three scrolls where Kankuro grew." Tsunade's eyes went wide.

"Inform Kakashi and have him meet the arriving team," Tsunade said, "And don't open that door." Jiraiya looked at Tsunade. Her tone wasn't one he had heard in many years.

"What are you planning?" Jiriaya asked Tsunade.

"My job," Tsunade said, before Jiraiya closed the door.

"This might just make things worse," Jiraiya said, puffing away. Tsunade looked over what her notes had on the symbols she copied from the first destroyed scroll and one of Orochimaru's.

"I might be able to do it," Tsunade thought, "I might just be able to make my own growth scroll."
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: A growth of knowledge

choices: Kakashi puts together a team and heads out to fight Sasori
Tsunade succeeds in making a growth scroll
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
In his hiding spot, Sasori was making more growth scrolls in the hope to strengthen his small amount of forces. He was hoping to have at least four giants on his side to take on the giants in the Leaf Village. Unfortunately, there were many giants on the side of the Leaf Village. Luckily, a chunk of them were only about ten to twenty feet tall. Sasori was hopping to create a smaller group of bigger giants.

"Let them have their pawns." He thought to himself. "I'll give them queens."

Konohamaru was keeping a lookout for Sasori in case they were attacked by the Leaf shinobi again. Suddenly, the ground vibrated under his feet. Looking around Konohamaru was surprised to see a giant coming straight toward them at high speed! He crouched down and said, "Master! A giant is coming this way."

Sasori put another growth scroll on the pile and said, "Show me."

Konohamaru lifted Sasori into the air and pointed toward the incoming giant. Sasori smiled and said, "I recognize him. He's not from the Leaf Village at least."

Konohamaru prepared for the coming giant ready in case he was going to attack. The giant, however, was not looking for a fight which was probably good for Konohamaru since he was at least forty feet taller than him. As he stopped in front of Sasori he said, "I've arrived Master Sasori."

Sasori nodded and said, "Very well. You're the Puppet Master from the Sand Village aren't you?:"

Kankuro nodded and said, "What are your orders?"

Sasori thought about it and said, "For now, keep watch with the boy. I have a few more scrolls to make in preparation for our attack on the Leaf Village. Judging by your size I'm assuming Deidara and the others used all three scrolls on you. If you two are my only puppets, I'm going to need you big enough to be of good use."

Konohamaru put Sasori down and Sasori went back to work making the scrolls. As Sasori prepared to strengthen his forces, Gaara, Temari, and their sensei were arriving at the Leaf Village. Kakashi was there waiting for them. "Good. You made it."

Temari nodded and said, "Has Kankuro been spotted yet?"

Kakashi shook his head and said, "We believe he's joined Sasori. We're getting ready to mount an attack on him once we get a team together. The Hokage left choosing the team up to me."

Temari stepped forward and said, "Then let me be part of that team! It's my brother out there after all!"

Kakashi shook his head and said, "I can't. The giants have too much power for an ordinary ninja to fight. Their size gives them greater power and greater defense. Normal ninjutsu will have little to no effect. Even the stronger attacks don't do more than ordinary close quarters attacks. I will need Gaara though since he's one of the larger giants."

Gaara nodded and said, "I expected that."

"Then come on." Kakashi said. "We're going to get the others for the team. You two go to the hospital. The Hokage entrusted Shizune with giving out separate missions relating to backup for whatever may come."

Temari and her sensei headed toward the hospital while Gaara and Kakashi started looking through the village for suitable candidates to add to their team to head for an attack on Sasori.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Preparations

choices: Just give the scroll to a medium or large giant and see what happens, very huge
Test a little on a smaller giant.  They grow to 100ft tall easily
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Tsunade was breathing hard. Making the scroll had been far more difficult than she expected. "I just hope this works," she thought, examining the dust on the scroll. While Orochimaru's was green and Sasori's was a red-amber, the dust before Tsunade was pinkish-blue. "Now I'll need a male to try it on." With that, Tsunade departed her office in search of a test subject.

In truth, the process of making the growth dust wasn't hard with the symbols. What drained each of the creators was putting their own will into the dust, to determine what exactly became of the giant after growth. Orochimaru desired corruption and power to be given to the victor. Sasori wanted complete subjugation. Tsunade's dust was different to a degree. The dust she created, unknowingly to her, would work best on those who already grew, amplifying their power, much like how she amplifies her own strength with chakra control. But like all the others, enough exposer to the dust would lead to the person serving Tsunade as a slave. Tsunade only knew the last part for certain.

Tsunade approached where many of the giants were waiting for Kakashi to tell them if they would be picked to go on the mission.

"Who should I pick?" Tsunade thought, "Kakashi should be a good choice, since it'd better to have him the largest over Naruto. But Naruto has shown to be quiet ingenious with his new found power, if a bit flaunting. Shikamaru or Iruka would also be good, as both are chunin. Then there are the little giants who didn't last very long. But I also don't even know what this dust will do. Maybe I should try a test a little dust on someone first?"
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: A new giant maker

choices: Team Kakashi finds Sasori. Sasori's been waiting for them.
Tsunade performs more experiments with the growth dust.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Tsunade started eliminating her choices one by one.

"Naruto is out since he's already big enough. Besides that I want to use this on someone who won't make trouble for the village when this whole thing is over. I don't think I should give it to Kakashi either. He's already able to hold his own against even bigger giants when his mind is clear. Giving him the scroll would be overkill. None of the smaller giants will work either since they won't get much bigger. Knowing Sasori he isn't just waiting around for us to attack him. He's no doubt strengthening his own forces and we need to do the same. Shikamaru is smart, but too lazy. There's no guarantee he'll do any work after this is over if he's the biggest giant around the village. Sasuke is too volatile and Gaara isn't from the village. That leaves Iruka. Hmm...That's not a bad idea. He's reliable, he's responsible, and he's proven he can hold his own against even the Akatsuki at his current size. If he's even larger he should prove quite useful. Alright. Iruka it is then."

All of this went through Tsunade's mind as she watched the team before her. Having finally decided she walked up to the group and said, "Alright! Before you guys leave I have something for you."

She held up the scroll and continued, "After studying the scroll we stole from Sasori and the dust we obtained from Konohamaru's scarf I've managed to make a growth scroll of my own. For this mission, I've decided to give it to one of you."

Instantly Naruto shouted out, "Oooh! Granny Tsunade! Pick me! I want the scroll!"

Kakashi smacked Naruto on the head and said, "Be quiet Naruto. You can get big enough already."

"There's no such thing as enough when it comes to training!" Naruto shouted. "I want it so bad! Come on, please!"

Tsunade shook her head and said, "Sorry Naruto but I agree with Kakashi. You're both already good enough at your current size. I need to give this to someone who can be trusted not to make trouble after this whole thing is over and isn't already too big."

Some of the smaller giants had hopeful looks on their faces but Tsunade shook her head and said, "But they have to already have a pretty good size. At least over twenty feet."

Naruto crossed his arms and looked around, "But who's that then?"

Tsunade walked up to Iruka and said, "Here Iruka. I know we can trust you the most."

Iruka looked surprised but smiled and said, "Of course Lady Hokage. You can count on me."

Naruto snorted and put his arms behind his head. "Not fair."

Iruka laughed and said, "I've been looking for a way to get the edge over you again Naruto."

Naruto laughed and said, "Yeah right Iruka-sensei! There's no way you'll get as big as me!"

Tsunade said, "Don't be so sure Naruto. We don't know how effective this scroll will be. Just to be safe use it once you're outside the village."

With that, Tsunade headed back to the Hokage Mansion, standing out on the balcony to watch Iruka use the scroll. Team Kakashi made its way outside the village and walked about two hundred feet away. Tsunade spotted the group, nothing more than a collection of tiny figures on the horizon. She watched as one of the figures detached from the group and walked a short distance away. This was it. The moment of truth. As Tsunade watched, nervously biting her thumbnail, the team standing a short distance from Iruka was looking on in the same anticipation. The question on everyone's mind was how big Iruka would grow. With a deep breathe Iruka opened the scroll and the pink and blue dust blew out and surrounded him. As the dust cleared Iruka quickly started growing. The team collectively tilted their heads back further and further as Iruka continued growing. Kakashi turned to Naruto and said, "Naruto, grow to your full size. That way we'll have a yardstick to see how much Iruka grows."

Naruto nodded and quickly grew himself up to his full height, looking down on Iruka as he kept on growing. Naruto was shocked as Iruka came up past his waist, past his chest, and finally, with a grin on Iruka's part, past his head. Now even Naruto was looking up as Iruka continued growing up and up and up. Naruto and the rest of the team had to keep moving backward as Iruka's enormous feet started encroaching on them, his toes growing far above their base heights. And still Iruka continued growing. Past four hundred feet, then five hundred, then six hundred until he finally started slowing down at six hundred and seventy feet tall. Iruka looked down at the team and could just make out their tiny forms. Naruto, though quite a bit bigger than the rest of the team, was still small next to Iruka. Iruka laughed and said, "I told you Naruto."

Naruto frowned and said, "This doesn't change anything Iruka-sensei!"

Iruka shrunk himself back down, Naruto following suit though a little reluctantly. He was going to miss being the biggest around the village. As the team continued on looking for Sasori, Tsunade was walking back into her office, going over what she had just witnessed. Iruka had grown much much more than any other giant. The question was, would he lose his size if he lost in the coming match? If he did, they'd all be in trouble with a gigantic Kankuro or Konohamaru to deal with. Then again, depending on what Sasori was doing, they might have to deal with them anyway.

"I'd have to use the dust again to understand it completely. There are a few more giants around here..."

Tsunade closed the door to her office to ruminate over her choices.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: The Power of Tsunade's Scroll

choices: Jiraiya intercepts the three Akatsuki before team B gets there
Iruka and Naruto hold back the two titans, Kakashi goes after Sasori
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Kakashi looked at his team as they went. Shikamaru, Gaara, Naruto, Sasuke, Shizune and Iruka followed swiftly behind. Jiraiya said he'd come from another direction and not to worry about him.

"I wonder what he's planning," Kakashi thought before stopping his team. "All right, here's the plan," Kakashi said, "In all likelihood, Kankuro and Konohamaru are past the 200 foot mark. This means Gaara, Sasuke, Shikamaru, and Shizune can't go against them. You're task is two fold. First, protect Shizune, as she's the only med ninja on our squad. Two, reclaim Sakura. Three, if you have the opportunity, kill Sasori. Naruto, Iruka, and I will handle Kankuro and Konohamaru and the other Akatsuki members."

"Kakashi, where's pervy sage?" Naruto asked.

"He said he'd come from another direction," Kakashi said, "Keep an eye out, but don't lose focus from our mission." All nodded and Shizune moved near Sasuke and Shikamaru. They then got on the move again.

------------------

Kankuro glared at the Academy student, who was his partner. Both stood a nice 250 feet tall. "Stupid runt," Kankuro said.

"Shut up!" Konnohamaru replied, "You want to fight?"

"Stop it, both of you!" Sasori yelled. Both went quiet.

"So, we'll move to the side then, hmm," Deidara said, "And let your puppets take on the main heat."

"Stupid kids," Hidan said, "I still don't see why you didn't grow me like planned."

"Because if I had, we'd of needed a new member to the Akatsuki," Sasori replied, "You'll note these two have barely anything on. Our rings are valuable and breakable."

"Plus feeding you would cost us too much money," Kakuzu said.

"Fine," Hidan said, before the three moved into the back area. Sasori turned and watched as his team mates took the knocked out Sakura.

Suddenly, he saw something coming. He then jumped up to be on Kankuro's shoulder and waited.

Iruka, Naruto, and Kakashi came right out of the woods and looked up at the three shinobi.

"Let's get a bit bigger," Kakashi said to his team as they grew to match height, except Kakashi who was still short of 200 feet. Sasori looked at his opponents.

"This will be difficult," Sasori said, looking at his enemy.

Meanwhile Team B was gaining on the other Akatsukis and Sakura.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Preparing for the battle

choices: Team B is caught in a trap
Back with Team A...
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Sasori threw out his right hand and chakra strings attached to Konohamaru. Sasori felt that Kankuro would be able to handle himself yet Konohamaru would likely get beat quickly against opponents of an equal size. Kakashi hung back slightly as Iruka and Naruto moved forward, Iruka heading for Konohamaru while Naruto took on Kankuro. Just before Naruto reached Kankuro he created a group of Shadow Clones that jumped into the air, growing to their full gigantic height to press Kankuro in the same way they had Neji. Kankuro threw out his hands and five strings attached to two of the clones. With a twisting movement, Kankuro managed to turn the clones against the others, destroying them before they reached the ground.

"You're going to have to do better than that!" Kankuro said, guiding the clones in front of him.

"I should have known Sasori would teach him something like that. I don't think Kankuro was capable of controlling humans before." Kakashi thought, moving silently behind Kankuro.

The clones were not liking being under anyone's control. The looks of displeasure on their faces was enough to broadcast what they thought of the whole situation. While Naruto was facing down this small army, Iruka was trying his best to subdue Konohamaru without actually hurting him. Konohamaru was relying on his new size and strength to help him win since he lacked any serious ninjutsu. Iruka was matching him, blocking his blows and landing a few of his own. Iruka didn't like the idea of fighting one of his students but he hated the idea of one of his student's being controlled against their will. This thought spurred him on causing him to land more blows on Konohamaru. Konohamaru growled and pulled out a tiny ball. He threw it at Iruka causing it to explode in a tiny black cloud on his cheek. It did absolutely no damage but it surprised Iruka long enough for Konohamaru to slam his foot into Iruka's stomach. Konohamaru, being under Sasori's control, had no reason to hold back like Iruka so his kick was full force and Iruka was not expecting it.

The battle between the four titans raged on as Kakashi slowly got behind Kankuro, ready to attack and grab Sasori off Kankuro's shoulder. Just as he was about to attack Kankuro pulled his left hand around and caused one of Naruto's clones to guard him from behind. Turning slightly, Kankuro was able to send one clone after Naruto and the other after Kakashi. Sasori smiled as this fight went on, the odds clearly in his favor.

Not too far from this position, Team B was heading out to engage the other Akatsuki in battle. Since they had so many giants of varying sizes on their side they didn't anticipate any problems. The biggest obstacle, was finding them. Shikamaru stopped suddenly and held out his hand. The group came to a halt next to a clearing. Shizune, hanging onto Sasuke's back, asked, "What's wrong?"

Shikamaru put a finger to his lips then pointed at the clearing. Everyone looked and saw two of the Akatsuki members standing in the clearing, talking. Looking closer, they saw Sakura tied up between them. Sasuke was instantly suspicious. "This seems almost too easy."

Shikamaru nodded and whispered, "Yeah, I know what you mean. It's more than likely a trap."

Shizune looked nervous as she said, "What should we do?"

Gaara quietly said, "Surround them. If we attack from all sides, they won't be able to target us in a big group."

Shikamaru nodded and said, "Sounds like a plan. Me and Shizune will go one way, Sasuke and Gaara go the other. We'll all attack at once after six minutes have passed."

Sasuke handed Shizune over to Shikamaru who started moving to the left. Sasuke and Gaara headed to the right. Once each giant was in a different spot around the clearing, forming a triangle with the Akatsuki in the center, they had one minute before the attack would begin.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: The Battle Begins

choices: Team B gets Sakura, and go to aid Jiraiya
Back to Team A, Iruka goes 400 feet for the win
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"Now," Shikamaru said over the radio and the three giants and Shizune went after the Akatsuki.

In the clearing, Hidan and Kakuzu were talking.

"I'm telling you we should make another scroll and grow me!" Hidan yelled.

"And I'm telling you to shut up," Kakuzu said. Suddenly three massive people came in from different directions. "It seems we were found out," Kakusu said before twitching slightly. Hidan also began twitching. Even Sakura was twitching. Shizune's eyes went wide.

"Retreat! Their bombs!" Shizune said as the giants retreated. Actually, Gaara didn't retreat, but instead tried to contain the explosions in his sand coffin. Due to the strength of the three, this was a costly act on his chakra, but no damage was done. Shikamaru and Sasuke exchanged glances. Both thought the same thing: Someone had to of been watching to know when to blow the bombs.

"Spread out and find them," Shikamaru ordered, walking along in one direction. Gaara merely stood still, staring off into nothing. Sasuke went to one direction they didn't come from.

"I found one," Gaara said, raising his hand when out of the ground, Deidara appeared, covered in sand.

"You little bastard, hmm," Deidara said, "How did you find me?"

"I made everything beneath the top soil into sand. Finding you was easy," Gaara said, "Now where are your team mates?"

"Those idiots?" Deidara said, "I told them to leave you to me. They went off somewhere else. Not sure really."

"Then you're not needed to live anymore," Gaara said as he started crushing Deidara from the legs up slowly.

"I thought he had changed," Shikamaru said quietly to Sasuke.

"He has,' Sasuke said, "He hasn't tried killing us, has he?"

"All right, I'll tell you, they went that way! hmm," Deidara yelled nodding his head northward after his pelvis was crushed.

"Thank you," Gaara said before encasing all of Deidara in sand and killing him..

"All right, let's get moving," Shikamaru said, ignoring the blood now dripping from Gaara's sand.

Meanwhile, the real Kakuzu and Hidan were moving south with Sakura on Hidan's shoulder. He was smiling.

"Virgin sacrifices," Hidan said, "That's something I haven't done in a long time."

"Just tell me how long this stupid ceremony will take?" Kakuzu said, "I'm not in the mood for a long one. We do have enemy forces tracking us."

"Only a half hour," Hidan said when something shot out of the woods and grabbed Sakura. Kakuzu barely had time to see the toad's tongue rescue Sakura when Jiraiya came from the other side, with his sword from before drawn and ready. He charged forward and decapitated Hidan again.

"This was miscalculated," Kakuzu said, seeing his partner was down, again.

"I'd say so," Jiraiya said, looking at Kakuzu, while the toad from before grabbed Hidan's head from a distance. It picked up the injured Sakura and went after Team B.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Two traps sprung

choices: Team A finds Team B having trouble with Kakuzu (possible reinforcements)
Someone sneaks up on Iruka
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
The fight between the human puppets and the Leaf Ninja were not looking good. With no need for restraint Kankuro and Konohamaru were able to fight viciously with intent to kill. Neither Naruto nor Iruka wanted either giant hurt so they were slightly pulling their punches and aiming not to permanently injure. With the situation looking grim, Iruka knew he had only one choice. He quickly grew another two hundred feet reaching 400 feet tall. Konohamaru, who had been aiming a punch at his face suddenly found himself punching his teachers thigh. Iruka ignored Konohamaru for a moment and grabbed the two Naruto clones by their collars, bashing their heads together and causing them to disappear, Kankuro's chakra strings falling to the ground. Kakashi took this moment to dart forward and grab Sasori in his hands.
