Before Sasori could bring Konohamaru around to attack Kakashi, before he could try to attach chakra strings to control Kakashi, Kakashi closed his fist around the Puppet Master, crushing his body to death. With the death of Sasori, Kankuro and Konohamaru lost their will to fight. Both just stood there waiting new orders but without Sasori they would be waiting forever.

Naruto wiped some sweat off his forehead and said, "That was close! Now we just gotta wait for Shizune and Pervy Sage so we can fix these guys!"

Kakashi dropped Sasori's body to the ground and put his foot on it, grinding the remains into dust. Iruka helped the two boys to lay down on the ground. They were compliant to the touch and quickly laid down their eyes staring up into the sky still waiting. Iruka and Naruto shrunk back down to a height closer to Kakashi so they could talk while they waited. It didn't take long for Jiraiya to suddenly burst through the trees followed by a toad. In the toad's tongue was Sakura which the toad laid carefully down. During all the excitement she had fainted the strain of being kidnapped and the worry about dieing for so long finally catching up to her. Another fifteen minutes passed and still Team B hadn't come back. Iruka turned to Jiraiya and said, "Did you see them anywhere?"

Jiraiya nodded. "They were making an attack and had almost fallen into a trap. Gaara took out one of the Akatsuki members and I stole the head from the other one."

Almost everyone gave Jiraiya a weird look and he sighed and said, "Don't ask. The point is there's still one more Akatsuki member out there and we don't have any idea what his powers might be."

"It's also possible they've got reinforcements." Kakashi said. "There were only four that came to attack the Leaf Village. That leaves six members still out there."

Naruto started looking uncomfortable as he asked, "I'm not liking the sound of that. Shouldn't we go find them? It's not like they're going anywhere!"

That was true. Jiraiya said, "Alright. Naruto, Kakashi, and me will all go looking for Team B and assist them if they need it. Iruka will stay here and guard these two to make sure nothing happens to them. Let's go!"

Iruka grew to three hundred feet tall to keep a lookout as the rest of Team A headed out to look for Team B.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Akatsuki on the Ropes

choices: Shizune shrinks one now/Tsunade made small amount of dust to experiment with
both at home/Tsunade made dust of varying size,fine grain to course(fine strngr)
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Kakuzu looked at the place Jiraiya retreated to. "This is bad," he thought, "Those Leaf Shinobi are really powerful now. And I doubt I could take them on on my own." Suddenly Pein contacted him telepathically.

"Kakusu, what's happened?" Pein asked.

"Hidan's head was stolen, and I don't know how the others are doing," Pein replied.

"Sasori and Deidara are dead," Pein replied, "I want you to retreat to a safe location."

"That'd be smart. Since I doubt Hidan's going to get his head back, mind if I sell it off?" Kakuzu asked.

"No, we'll need the money anyway," Pein replied before ending the connection. Kakuzu picked up Hidan's headless body and ran off.

Elsewhere, Team B was closing in on Kakuzu's location, but wouldn't find him.

"Damn it, where's Sakura!" sasuke said, looking around.

"Getting angry at us won't help the matter," Shikamaru said.

"I know, but," Sasuke said before Shizune spoke up.

"There was a fight here," Shizune said jumping down to Shikamaru's feet. He then shrunk to six feet. The other two followed suit.

"How can you be sure?" Shikamaru asked.

"I've seen many fights," Shizune replied. Suddenly all could feel the sounds of approaching feet. Giant's feet at that. All looked and saw a giant Naruto appear. Naruot looked down and shrunk to their size.

"Found you guys," he said, "What's happened?"

"Gaara killed a blond Akatsuki," Shikamau replied, "And you guys?"

"Kakashi killed the controller and Pervy Sage got Sakura back. Iruka's watching Konohamaru and your brother, while Jiraiya, Kakashi and I look for you. Head back towards Iruka. I'll see you there," Naruto said, before puffing away.

"I guess we can head back," Shikamaru said, before looking at Gaara. "What's up?"

"I wonder how my village will accept another giant?" Gaara said before running off towards Iruka. The other three followed suit.

Elsewhere, the real Naruto told Jiraiya and Kakashi of finding Team B and they retreated to Iruka as well.

Iruka stood tall, watching for any signs of approach. Suddenly, he turned around and looked down.

"What are you doing here Lee?" Iruka asked the 15 foot tall ninja, but to the 300 ft Iruka, he looked closer to 3 inches.

"I heard Sakura-san was captured and came to help!" Lee shouted upwards.

"Lee, you're not big enough to help against them," Iruka said pointing to the giant mountains that were Konohamaru and Konkuro.

"I know, but I wanted to try anyway!" Lee shouted when suddenly the rest of Team A and Team B arrived.

"Bushy brows? What are you doing here?" Naruto asked the tiny ninja.

"He wanted to help," Iruka said.

"That's Guy's student for you," Kakashi thought. Jiraiya shook his head.

"Well now that we're back together, should we shrink one ninja and let Tsunade do the other?" Jiraiya asked, "It took a lot from Tsunade to heal Naruto the last time, Shizune. Or do you want to carry them back to the village?"
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Calvary arrives

choices: Kiba, Shino, Lee, Asuma, Choji (1,2,3,4,5)
Lee, Shino, Asuma, Kiba, Choji (1,2,3,4,5)
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"Judging from the size of them, I don't think I'll be able to do much on my own." Shizune said. "Let's just transport them back to the village."

With that decided Iruka grew to his full, and impressive, size of six hundred and seventy feet tall. At that size he was able to carry the smaller giants under one arm. To make the trip go faster, the other ninja rode in his other hand with plenty of spare room. The trip was over in a few minutes thanks to Iruka's increased speed. When they got back, Shizune quickly ran to the Hokage's Mansion and knocked on Tsunade's office. Tsunade's voice issued out, "If you're a man, just open the door. If you're a woman, then come in."

Shizune opened the door and walked inside. Tsunade looked up from about five piles of blue and pink dust and said, "Shizune! What have you got to report?"

Shizune quickly said, "The mission was a success. We subdued Kankuro and Konohamaru and eliminated two members of the Akatsuki. Sakura was also recovered.."

Tsunade smiled and said, "Excellent. That just leaves the remaining members of Akatsuki to worry about. We should still be on guard in case they make any more moves. Judging from the amount of giants we have they'll probably try something covert.

Shizune agreed and said, "We had to transport the giants here for you to shrink."

Tsuande's smile disappeared as she heard this. She sighed and said, "I thought that might happen. Very well. I'll see to them immediately. Just make sure at least one giant above twenty feet is nearby to share chakra as well as some medical ninja who can transport the subjects back to the hospital."

Shizune nodded, her gaze drifting to the dust. "What exactly are you working on Lady Tsunade?"

Tsunade looked down at the dust piles and said, "I was planning on experimenting with the dust. I've created five piles here of varying coarseness. The pile to the far left is the coarsest while the dust to the far right is the finest. I think the fineness of the dust effects how powerful it is, but I haven't been able to test it to be sure. After we're done shrinking the giants I want these tested on the smallest giants. That means Choji, Shino, Kiba, Asuma, and Lee. Make sure that those five are gathered in the Training Field. I haven't decided yet who to give what dust..."

The two lady ninjas headed outside to the village borders where the two giants were lying down. Iruka placed her on Konohamaru's chest first, Jiraiya standing by with two scrolls to seal the chakra with. Iruka lent his chakra to Tsunade again allowing her to quickly cleanse Konohamaru who instantly began shrinking. Once he was down to his normal height he was placed on a stretcher and taken to the hospital. They repeated the process with Kankuro which was slightly more difficult since Tsunade was starting to feel the strain from creating the dust and almost immediately shrinking the giants. She was quite dizzy by the time Kankuro was taken to the hospital. Nevertheless, she went to the Training Field where the five smallest giants were waiting for her. She pulled out five scrolls and said, "I suppose you all know why you're here, but just in case I'll break it down for you. You are the five smallest giants. Therefore you are the perfect subjects for my latest tests. I have with me five scrolls. I labeled them one through five. I'm not sure which, but either one or five is the strongest. The rest get stronger from one on or from five down. Each of you come and take a scroll."

Each giant stepped forward and took a scroll. Once everyone had a scroll Tsunade said, "Alright, which of you has what scroll?"

She pulled out a journal and jotted down the names of the ninja and the number of scroll they got. Once that was done she nodded and said, "Open the scrolls!"

What they didn't know was that the fine dust was the strongest while the coarse dust was the weakest. Scroll One had the fine dust in it, but who got what scroll?
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Shrinking the Giants and Making More

choices: The six giants are loyal, but not slaves/Naruto & Sasuke not happy with results
Elsewhere, Itachi is decided to make the next giants for the Akatsuki
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"So either Lee or Choji will be the largest," Tsunade thought backing up, "And the dust given to Iruka was the same in to scroll 3, so that just makes a bench mark of 13 times larger. I just hope the strongest isn't over 15 times their size."

Kiba stood back from Akamaru. "Sorry buddy, we don't know how this would affect you. It was made for humans, not dogs," Kiba said as Akamaru ran over to Tsunade.

The five ninjas moved away from each other then opened the scrolls. The pink and blue dust was slowly coating their bodies. Once done, all five shot upwards very quickly. Choji was growing the fastest upwards But it seemed as soon as he started, he stopped. Scroll 5 had increased his 12 feet max to 108 feet tall, 9 times his original.

Kiba took a deep breath as he rose taller and more muscular. From his 11 foot beginning, he rose to 121 feet tall. "Hah, now I'm taller than you Choji!" Kiba said, smiling. Akamaru gave a happy yelp at Kiba's happiness.

Asuma kept focused on how exactly his body was changing, from his vision getting better to the sheer power in his little pinky. As he grew 13 times his original size, he soon topped off at 130 feet tall. He was inwardly happy he was larger than his students once again, so persuading Shikamaru and Choji was no problem.

"Now what about those two?" Tsunade thought, seeing Asuma level off and Choji was smaller than him. It seemed that even though the others grew faster, the grew smaller, while Lee and Shino were growing taller, it was not as fast as the other three.

Shino kept his normal poker face on as he went higher and higher. Shino had started with a maximum of 13 feet tall. But now he was rising above Asuma a great deal. He continued skyward, until he stopped at 195 feet tall, 15 times his original maximum.

Though Tsunade couldn't tell exactly how tall Shino was, she could guess he was near 200 feet. Deep in her gut, she had wished Asuma had taken Scroll 1, for a 200 foot plus clone of Guy would not be the easiest thing to handle. As Tsunade turned to the last growing giant, she watched as he slowly gained on Shino and soon rose above him, climbing higher and higher.

"Lee!" Tsunade shouted, "Don't even think about jumping!" But Lee couldn't hear her. Thankfully, Choji did and passed the words up the line until Shino yelled it at Lee.

"Right Lady Hokage!" Lee shouted back, causing Tsunade to cover her ears. She really wished someone else had gotten Scroll 1. Eventually, Lee slowed down and stopped at an even 300 feet tall, 20 times his original maximum. Tsunade looked at the giants she grew and knew the base of power had shifted in the village. While there was no issue with Iruka being taller than Naruto, as Kakashi was the 3rd tallest, Tsunade knew that with two more students in that height range, their might be issues. She also wondered how much influence she'd have over them since they used her scrolls?
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Who is the tallest of them all?

choices: Itachi makes some scrolls and looks for someone to use it on
Back at the village, jealousy starts dividing the Leaf shinobi...
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As Tsunade continued to experiment with the dust, the Akatsuki were regrouping at their hideout to discuss their next move. Unfortunately, they were now three members short. Yet there was a new face among the Akatsuki...so to speak. He was wearing a strange orange spiral mask with only one eye hole and was looking around excitedly. Kakuzu dropped a bag full of money onto the ground and said, "Hidan was worth more than I thought he would be."

Pein nodded and said, "Any member of the Akatsuki would fetch a high price on the black market. But now is not the time to be discussing business ventures. The Leaf Village has thwarted our every attempt at attacking them. In fact, our efforts have led to strengthening the village as every giant defeated is added to the growing force of the village."

Kisame laughed and said, "Well what do you expect? They managed to kill Orochimaru with little effort."

Pein nodded again and said, "Orochimaru developed this jutsu and had the most experience with it. There will be no more direct attacks on the village. Instead we will covertly attack them."

Kakuzu asked, "What's your plan then?"

Itachi stepped forward and said, "Psychological warfare correct?"

Pein turned his eyes on Itachi and said, "Exactly. With so many giants on their side questions of status will soon arise. Eventually a rift will be driven between the giants themselves, between the giants and the village. Eventually the whole village will be in turmoil and that is when we'll make our move. In the meantime we will need more giants on our side. Since Itachi copied the jutsu through his Sharingan he will make the scrolls."

Itachi nodded and pulled out a few scrolls, heading for the exit where the light was better to start making the scrolls. Kakuzu turned to Pein and said, "What about the rest of us? What are we supposed to do?"

Pein turned to Kakuzu and said, "We wait. The seeds of dissent will be sown without our aid."

Kakuzu sighed and said, "Whatever." he pulled out a list of names and continued, "I'm going to step out for the next few days then and see if I can't get some more cash."

The man with the mask had been waiting quietly by the side lines waiting for Pein to say something about him. When it became clear that he wasn't going to say anything he stepped forward and said, "Pein-sama? What am I supposed to do?"

Pein looked the man up and down and said, "Tobi...I want you to watch Itachi and Kisame work. Since we're short members you'll be unofficially paired with those two until we can get some new members."

Tobi nodded eagerly and ran out after Itachi and Kisame. Konan walked with Pein and asked, "Is it wise to send him out like this?"

Pein nodded and said, "We both know he's more than capable of taking care of himself..."
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Akatsuki's New Approach

choices: Jiraiya asks Tsunade to stop and finds she made a dust even finer than Scroll 1
Team 7 departs for home and Sakura wonders if she could make her own growth dust
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Sasuke sat a rock and sighed deeply. "I hate this," he thought, "Why didn't Tsunade pick me for one of her scrolls? Next to those five, I was the shortest. Couldn't she of made a scroll six?" The news of Tsunade's experiment spread fast throughout the village. While Naruto was uneasy with such a large Lee, Sasuke was really pissed that he was now the smallest of the giants.

"Hey Sasuke, sulking won't help any," Naruto said looking over at his friend. After the mission yesterday, them and Sakura were given the day off to rest up. They were now in the woods, discussing what happened.

"Shut up Naruto," Sasuke said, "I don't want to talk about it."

"Sasuke, if its any consolation, at equal height, I know you could beat most of the other giants," Sakura said gently. Sasuke merely grunted in response.

Elsewhere, Team Guy was having a dinner together to celebrate both Neji getting out of the hospital and Lee's new height.

"Oh and seeing so far was amazing Guy Sensei!" Lee exclaimed, "I can't wait to see if I get another growth scroll! Maybe if I'm the largest, the one I love will choose me!"

"Lee, all you did on the walk over here was talk your new height. Give it a rest," Neji said, angry not at Lee being taller than him, but how Lee was given the height on a silver platter, while he, Neji, had to fight his friends because he was enslaved.

"Lee, Neji's right," Guy said, "As punishment, I want you to walk backwards on your hands around the interior of the village 1000 times. And you have to remain your smallest."

"Right away Guy Sensei!" Lee shouted before leaving table quickly.

"You know," Tenten said quietly after Lee left, "I'm worried what will happen if he ever gets any sake in him now. I mean, without either Naruto or Iruka-sensei present, Lee could level the village easily."

"That's why, as his teammates, we have to insure that doesn't happen. Right Neji?" Guy asked.

"Right," Neji said.

Elsewhere still, Konohamaru was enjoying more respect from his peers at the Academy due to his new stature.

"Man, being that tall was great!" Konohamaru said, smiling, "I could of done anything I liked." The girls near him were fawning over him, while the guys looked on in envy and anger.

"But still small enough for me to beat you as easily as before," Iruka said, looking at Konohamaru while he was reading a book during a study period.

"Right Iruka-sensei," Konohamaru replied.

For once in his life, Jiraiya wasn't using his telescope to peep on women. Instead, he was monitoring different people to see how they reacted to Tsunade's actions. Unknown to many, he was present at Team 7's chat in the woods and the dinner talk with Team Guy. This made him feel uneasy.

"And Tsunade's still experimenting with the stuff," Jiraiya mumbled as he went on his way to Tsunade's mansion. He wanted to ask her to stop this dust making before things got out of hand.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: The seeds planted

choices: Jiraiya delivers Shikamaru the scroll and he grows
Tsunade and Shizune start trying to heal the bonds of the village
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Jiraiya didn't like the signs that were popping up around the village. This business with the giants had slowly been driving a wedge between the normal people of the village and the giants and between the giants themselves. It wasn't good for the whole of the village and it needed to be stopped. He quickly jumped up to the window at Tsunade's office and said, "We need to talk."

Tsunade jumped and quickly rolled another scroll up. "You know you're not supposed to come in that way. What if I had dust out?"

Jiraiya walked into the room and said, "That dust is exactly what I've come to talk to you about."

Tsunade tucked the scroll away in her shirt and said, "Are you worried?"

"Of course I'm worried." Jiraiya said. "I've been watching the people of the village and how they've been dealing with this situation. The primary emotions throughout the village have been anger and jealousy. The giant situation hasn't been good for the village and the more you experiment with it the worse it's going to get."

Tsunade sighed and said, "Jiraiya. This business has done nothing but improve our standing in the world. No one would be fool enough to attack us with so many giants on our side. Why should we stop now? Frankly, it doesn't matter how big the giants get since they can shrink down to normal size and interact with the normal people of the village."

Jiraiya frowned and said, "Well suppose one of them decided they don't want to follow the ways of the village anymore? What would stop them from destroying the village?"

Tsunade stood up and said, "The other giants of course."

Jiraiya walked over to Tsunade's desk and said, "What if all the giants decide to leave?"

Tsunade smiled and said, "Well then we simply make a scroll with a stronger controlling force. Even if Naruto tried to leave we could use scrolls on the other giants to not only increase their size but increase our dominance over them."

Jiraiya looked shocked as he heard this. "Tsunade are you listening to yourself? You're starting to sound like Orochimaru! Do you really want to subjugate the entire village?"

Tsunade frowned and said, "I guess I never really thought about it like that...You're right Jiraiya. This power is too much for the village. We should cut our losses now and try to improve the relationships with the people of the village. However, I don't want to waste this."

She pulled out the scroll and said, "So the only question is, who do we give it to?"

Jiraiya thought for awhile and said, "How strong is it?"

Tsunade shook her head. "I have no idea. The dust is even finer than the dust I used on Lee so it's safe to say it'll make someone over 20 times their size."

Jiraiya frowned as he heard this. "I'm not sure we should use it on anyone. It could make things much worse."

Tsunade shook her head again and said, "We have to use it. What if the scroll falls into the wrong hands? And I'm not just talking about Akatsuki. Sasuke has been nothing but trouble since he grew so I don't want him getting this scroll. There's a reason he's the smallest right now."

Jiraiya nodded and said, "Well then who? Definitely not Iruka. He's big enough as it is."

Tsunade started listing names off, "Choji could use it. I don't think he'd make much trouble though his obsession with food could make trouble. The last thing we need is a rampaging Akimiji. Then there's Shino. He's already a bit too big I think though he wouldn't make trouble either. Kiba is out as well as Naruto and Kakashi since they have too great a base height. Asuma is another idea."

Jiraiya snapped his fingers and said, "What about Shikamaru? He's not too big and he's already proven his loyalty before. Not to mention he's so lazy he's not likely to make trouble."

Tsunade bit her lip and said, "I suppose it would be better to have someone too lazy to do anything than someone who might turn on the village or otherwise make trouble. Alright, Shikamaru it is."

She handed Jiraiya the scroll and said, "Deliver it to him and make sure he grows in a clear area away from the village. I'm going to send Shizune and myself out into the village to start repairing our bonds."

Jiraiya nodded and said, "If we're not careful Akatsuki will take advantage of our disunion and attack. We have to be ready."

Tsunade nodded slowly and said, "I just hope they'll listen."
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: The Last Scroll and the Mission to Unify the Leaf

choices: Shikamaru shrinks and Temari reveals herself/ Tsunade meets Team 7
Temari doesn't show her self, Shizune meets up with Team Guy
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"Come on Gaara, I feel fine," Kankuro said as he sat in the hospital room. "Why can't we get out of here?"

"Because the Lady Hokage asked for some special garments be made for you so you can grow without becoming nude," Gaara said, "Unless you want to become nude any time you grow over ten feet." Kankuro looked at his brother.

"Fine. How much longer until they're made?" Kankuro asked.

"They should be ready by tomorrow morning. Temari went to find out for sure," Gaara said. Kankuro nodded. He wondered if that was the only reason for her going out into the village.

Temari smiled as she drank some tea at the tea shop. Across from her was Shikamaru Nara. Temari was returning from the Akimichi's clan residence when she ran into Shikamaru and persuaded him to have some tea with her.

"So, what's it like growing that big?" Temari asked, "Gaara doesn't talk about it much since he returned."

"It's nice in a way," Shikamaru said, "My jutsus are stronger and my chakra reserves are higher. Plus the clouds look the same from any height I can grow to. Down side is I have to do more manual labor around the village." He then gave a sigh.

"You really don't like doing more than you need to," Temari said, "And it doesn't bother you that you're now the second smallest giant in the village?"

"Nah," Shikamaru said, "I actually don't care, as long as no one bothers me. With so many more giants, the odds of me fighting more Akatsuki are slim."

"But from what I heard, you did a great job at it," came a voice from behind Shikamaru. From no where, Jiraiya appears.

"Man, what do you want?" Shikamaru asked, not caring who Jiraiya was. Temari didn't know him either.

"I need you to come with me outside the village," Jiraiya said pleasantly.

"Is it needed? Or may I refuse?" Shikamaru asked.

"Well, refusal's always an option. But it would also mean a live show rather than pictures being given out," Jiraiya said, smiling. Shikamaru's face was drained a little of its color as he took a sip of tea. Temari noticed this.

"What does that mean?" Temari asked.

"Never mind," Shikamaru said, standing up, "I need to go with him. Here's the cash for my drinks." As he put the money on the table, Jiraiya waited. Soon Temari was left alone, eeing Shikamaru left enough for both their drinks.

"Where are we going?" Shikamaru asked the Sannin.

"This way," Jiraiya said, "Orders from the Hokage." Shikamaru shook his head and followed. Jiraiya led Shikamaru through side alleyways and up abandoned streets. Shikamaru knew then what was going down wasn't something they wanted company for. Soon they made it to the woods and to a large lake in the woods.

"What's the point of coming here?" Shikamaru asked.

"Do you know how deep this lake is?" Jiraiya asked.

"No, why?" Shikamaru asked.

"Simple enough, your to take that boat over there and head to the center," Jiraiya said.

"I can walk on water just as easily," Shikamaru said.

"But then it'd be like you were on level ground. I want you to go a bit into the water," Jiraiya said, pulling out the last scroll. "The Hokage wants you to use it on yourself." Shikamaru's eyes widened.

"No way," Shikamaru said.

"Yes," Jiraiya said, "You were chosen because you are trustworthy, loyal, smart, and not ambitious or easily influenced. The Hokage wants this scroll used up. Keeping it hidden only allows for someone to find it. Can you imagine what it'd be like if the Akatsuki finds it? Or Sasuke Uchiha?" Shikamaru grunted. With his mind it didn't take long for him to come up with 100 different worst case scenarios, depending on who found the scroll.

"I guess I should take this as a compliment," Shikamaru said taking the scroll and getting in the boat. Jiraiya gave it a good kick and soon Shikamaru was over the deepest part of the lake, roughly speaking 300 feet deep. Shikamaru held the scroll to his chest and released the dust. Then the growth started. Slowly he grew with his clothes to match. Soon his weight became to much for the boat and it sunk beneath him. It was an odd sensation to Shikamaru, growing down rather than up. Jiraiya could only hope he didn't get so large, the lake didn't help conceal him. No one was meant to know about Shikamaru's full height.

Unknown to Jiraiya, Temari followed the pair and saw Shikamaru take the scroll and now grow. Though only his head was above water, Temari saw it increase in size. "I hope he's all right," Temari thought.

Jiraiya saw Shikamaru start to rise from beneath the waves. "Man, he reached the bottom already? And he shows no sign of stopping." And Shikamaru didn't stop as he grew taller and taller. He finally stopped at six hundred seventy five, 27 times larger than his previous max and now the tallest ninja of all, though only 375 could be seen above the water line.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: The new big man in town

choices: Tsunade and Shizune continue healing bonds
The Akatsuki persuade/control some of the giants to help them
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Shikamaru quickly shrank himself down, rightfully thinking that a 375 foot upper body sticking out of the forest would be a dead giveaway to what was going on. When he back to normal size he walked along the water until he came to shore where Jiraiya was waiting for him. They were about to leave together to head back to the village when Temari walked out from her hiding place and said, "That was pretty impressive."

Shikamaru shrugged but Jiraiya frowned at the Sand girl. "I know you're an ally to the Leaf village but you shouldn't be sneaking around spying on people."

Temari smiled and said, "Well it's not like I could ever do anything to the village. My brothers alone wouldn't let me do anything let alone trying to do something with so many giants in this village. Truthfully, the Leaf doesn't need allies if it doesn't want them."

Jiraiya didn't like that line of thinking and said, "That doesn't matter. Shikamaru just used the last scroll so there will be no more growing. I don't want you to reveal your full height to anyone Shikamaru. I don't want there to be trouble between comrades."

Shikamaru agreed and said, "That's all you needed me for right?"

Jiraiya nodded and said, "I'm going to continue to monitor things around the village and keep a lookout for Akatsuki members. Don't do anything to antagonize the people of the village. If you get any opportunity help relations between us. The village is starting to get divided and that is something we can't afford."

Both ninja nodded and Jiraiya left, hoping that this thing wouldn't end up hurting them in the end after all...

As all this was going on, Tsunade and Shizune had managed to find Team 7 and was talking with them. She left the last scroll out of it, not wanting to start off by getting Naruto and Sasuke angry. Both boys and Sakura were sitting on a rock in the woods while Tsunade talked to them, Shizune there to lend moral support and help Tsunade if things were to get rough in any way. Tsunade looked between the two boys and said, "I thought you two would get along better after spending time together but I see that hasn't happened. Nor has either of you been very happy about the recent growings. Sasuke, did you ever stop to think that there was a reason behind my decision not to use you?"

Sasuke didn't say anything. Tsunade continued, "You are arrogant, volatile, and narrow minded. These are not good qualities of a protector of the Leaf Village. If it had been up to me, Naruto wouldn't be as big as he is either. I would've preferred to keep you both under twenty feet."

Naruto started to protest but Tsunade silenced him and continued, "You Naruto are loyal and kind but you also have a deep need to show off and try and prove yourself. That could mean easily falling into a trap and being used against us. The Akatsuki have the jutsu to make more scrolls and even though the Kyuubi keeps you from going completely under control at first it will eventually use the chakra as a means to escape from your body. That would be disastrous for the village."

Both boys said nothing, neither betraying his emotions. Tsunade continued, "The reason I want to talk to you both is because bonds in this village have begun to fray. Some are blinded by jealousy at others sizes while some are angry and afraid of the giants. This is not an atmosphere that should exist in this village. If things keep going the way they are the village will eventually become divided. To prevent this, I have decided that no more growth scrolls will be made ever again."

Sasuke's heart sank as he heard this. That meant that he was stuck forever at his "meager" height of twenty feet. Every other giant would always look down on him. Now that it was a fact instead of a mere speculation Sasuke would have to learn to deal with it. Tsunade smiled at him and said, "Perhaps revenge isn't the best course of action for you anymore. There are so many other ways to live your life. Don't throw it away by focusing on your brother. The reason you sought him out so fiercely was because you wanted revenge, but you also believed that no one else would be capable of it. Now we have a large group of ninja that can make it happen easily. I don't expect you to come to terms with this situation instantly but eventually you'll see. I'm confident in that."

Sasuke didn't know what to do or say so he just sat there, thinking about what he was going to do. Sakura patted him on the shoulder and he didn't pull away like he usually did. Sakura found this to be a good sign. Naruto saw that Sasuke was going to need some time to deal with this so he decided to stop worrying about everyone else and help his friend through his tough times. Tsunade turned to Shizune and said, "Alright, let's move on."

Shizune looked back at the three ninja sitting close together on the rock and thought, "Maybe everyone can learn to get along..."
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Healing Process

choices: Kakashi Asuma and Iruka go after Kiba and Choji/ Itachi goes after Kankuro
Gaara and Temari are with Kankuro in Hospital, Itachi finds Neji alone
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Itachi, Kisame, and Tobi came in view of Konoha.

"Seeing those building like that remind me of the last time we were here Itachi," Kisame said from beneath his hat, "Think we'll get a warm welcome like before?"

"Maybe if we bring them some flowers, they'll like us better?" Tobi said in a happy voice.

"No," Itachi said in a monotone voice.

"Aww," Tobi said.

"Geez Itachi, why are you so rude to Tobi?" Kisame asked.

"I have my reasons," Itachi replied, "Now our targets will be those who want more power and are weak to genjutsu.."

"Now you sound like Orochimaru," Kisame said, "Should we try your target?"

"No," Itachi said, "We'll want a smaller giant. One who we can grow and take control of." Itachi pulled out two scrolls he made earlier that day. While making it, he made a dust that would make the victim more susceptible to his sharigan persuasion, but only his and not any of the other sharigan users. "And now I need to go see for my spy," Itachi said, packing the scrolls away.

"Ohh, who could it be?" Tobi asked.

"You want me to come with you?" Kisame asked, "With so many giants, it could be dangerous."

"No," Itachi said, "Things will go differently from before." With that, Itachi walked to the village and entered past the guards. Using his sharigan, he hypnotized them and continued unscathed. Kisame and Tobi could only watch from a far.

Itachi walked along until he came to a back door in an alley way. He released the jutsu on his spy and waited. From the back door, Teuchi, the owner of the Ichiraku Ramen Shop came.

"Hello Itachi," Teuchi said quietly, "Care for a bowl on the house?"

"I want to know about the smallest gaints remaining in the village," Itachi said.

"The smallest ones are your brother at 20 feet and Shikamaru Nara at 25 feet," Teuchi said, "Tsunade made her own dust and grew the others so everyone else in the village are 100 feet or more. Choji Akimichi is the smallest of them along with Kiba Inuzuka. Neji Hyuuga is disgruntled for Rock Lee's new growth to 300 feet tall. And from what I heard some at the hospital say, Kankuro of Suna would like more power. He was one of your group's victims."

"Deliver these to the Akimichi and Inuzuka boys," Itachi said, holding out two scrolls.

"Yes Itachi," Teuchi said, taking the scrolls. Itachi disappeared but didn't leave the village. Instead, he went back to where the Uchiha used to live and rested while he made another scroll for Kankuro.

Tuechi returned to his daughter. "Ayame, what do you think of the giants?" Teuchi asked.

"Well, some people seem scared of them, why do you asked?" Ayame asked.

"I was thinking of giving some of them a free meal, since their mere presence helps protect the village," Teuchi said, "And why don't we start off with Kiba and Choji?"

"That's a wonderful idea," Ayame said, smiling, "I'll go send word to those two right now." She took off her apron and departed. And Teuchi set up the trap by placing small exploding tags on each scroll and putting them in the ramen. Once exposed to the air, they'd blow up.

Kiba and Choji soon came back and Teuchi had their bowls ready.

"I normally don't like ramen, but if it's free count me in," Kiba said digging in. Choji said nothing and started in as well. But ate fast and soon started draining the liquid from the bowls. Almost at the same time, both tags touched air and covered them in Itachi's dust. Ayame screamed at the sight of the explosion and then their sudden growth, while her father quietly slipped out the back.

As both giants grew taller and taller, they had three orders in their minds. First was to say they served Kakuzu and second to leave the village in two different directions and the third was to try and kill Tobi if the opportunity presented itself.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: A Spy in Konoha and the dagger ready

choices: Kankuro escapes with the other three giants. The Akatsuki now have three giants.
More Leaf ninja chase after the giants.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Of course, the sight of Kiba and Choji growing did not go unnoticed. Choji quickly grew from his old 108 foot tall height all the way up to 350 feet an impressive growth considering it was Itachi's first attempt at creating a scroll. Kiba, starting out bigger than Choji, grew even larger reaching 400 feet even. Instantly both boys took off through the village in different directions. Thinking fast, Kakashi and Asuma went after Choji while Iruka took off after Kiba.The three senseis had already been together discussing the events of the village and the movements of Akatsuki when they had spotted the two growing giants. Noticing the by now familiar slightly blank look in the eyes of the giants, the three ninja acted quickly. Since Iruka was the biggest he went after the bigger Kiba while the two smaller ninja went off after Choji. Itachi watched this all passively everything going exactly as planned for him. He knew that if he sent two giants off away from the village they would be sure to draw all attention away from what he was about to do next. Staying in the back alleys the missing-nin eventually reached the hospital. Once there he waited until a nurse came out on her lunch break. He hypnotized her and said, "Where is Kankuro of Suna staying?"

The nurse instantly responded, "He's on the third floor in room 356."

Itachi looked up at the hospital and said, "Point at the right window."

The nurse looked up at the third floor and pointed at a window that was near the corner of the building. Itachi released his grip and quickly escaped into the hospital leaving the nurse dazed and confused but with no memory of her encounter. Luckily, no one was in the room except Kankuro. He was in a hospital bed, wearing nothing except a hospital gown his face still clear of the usual stripes. He hadn't been allowed to leave the hospital for sometime and he was getting annoyed by the whole situation. He wanted to feel the feelings of power with a clear head instead in a fog of control. He was spending his time repairing small parts of Crow and Black Ant waiting for his custom clothes to be finished so he and his siblings could go home. He looked up in shock as Itachi arrived in the room, throwing the scroll at Kankuro. It exploded when it was inches from his face, covering him in dust. Itachi grabbed Kankuro and tossed him outside through the window as he started growing bigger and bigger. As soon as he hit the ground Kankuro went running outside the village, growing continuously as he went. Itachi stayed hidden in the shadows heading back to Kisame and Tobi.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Covert Action

choices: More are angry with the giants as Tsunade searches for a way to immunize growth
The village elders talk with TSunade about recent events/ Itachi fights Tobi
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Kankuro saw his comrades in trouble as he aimed to escape from the village, growing ever taller. Despite the huge issue at hand, there was only one silver lining to it. Itachi's dust was by far the most crude of them all, growing its victims 2 to 5 times their size. But to a 250 max before, that would still be a huge issue. Using his chakra strings, Kankuro pulled off the three senseis and sent them flying into each other as he leveled off at 700 feet tall. In their moment of disability, all three made a break for it.

After running for some distance, all three shrunk in size to ten feet tall, using what intelligence they had to know being that big was easy to track. At ten feet, they were fast and powerful enough to deal with normal ninjas who might stop them.

"Wow, that one guy was big," Kisame said as Itachi appeared.

"Oh, and he didn't have anything on," Tobi said, "Are you perverted like Orochimaru, Itachi-sama?" Itachi merely looked at Tobi and didn't say anything. Soon the three were off to find their newest slaves.

Back in the village, damage control was everywhere the giants stepped. With many more injured from this ambush than in Orochimaru's strike, the medical ninja were on the scene trying to get to everyone. Some of the giants also came to help clear out rubble and find injured people.

Team 7 looked around at the damage done. "Man, what happened? How did those guys grow like that?" Naruto asked aloud.

"Isn't it obvious? Someone hit them with a scroll," Sasuke said.

"We know that, but who was the maker?" Naruto wondered as they came to the three fallen teachers. All three were down to their normal old heights. "Kakashi," Naruto said.

"That Kankuro," Iruka said, "He's bigger than my max."

"Did either of you hear anything as to who might be their master?" Tsunade asked as she arrived to check them over.

"Kiba mentioned something about a Kakuzu," Iruka said, "Right before we got the surprise attack that is."

"How are we going to stop this?" Tsunade thought, "With them having the scroll, they can make more giants or ambush us at any time. What are we going to do?"
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: More threads frayed

choices: Itachi and Madara fight.
Tsunade thinks on the elders' words as she tries to think of a solution
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As the medical ninjas looked after the three senseis and the other giants helped in cleaning up after the three new rouge giants, Tsunade headed back to the Hokage Mansion. This madness had gone on long enough. She had to do something to combat the Akatsuki's knowledge about the scroll. She was determined not to make any more since that would only exacerbate the problems at hand. As she walked up the Hokage Mansion's staircase leading to her office she was stopped by two figures. Tsunade instantly knew who they were: The elders of the village, Homura and Koharu. If they had came out seeking Tsunade it probably meant trouble. Tsunade continued walking up the stairs and said, "What brings you both out here?"

Homura was the first to speak, "We need to talk Tsunade. The recent events in the village have gotten out of hand and we need to do something about it."

Tsunade indicated that they should go into her office. They did so and Tsunade asked, "What would you propose?"

Koharu said, "The villages safety is at stake so long as those giants exist in our midst. We come to you with two options: Find a way to permanently shrink them back to normal size."

Tsunade thought about that for a moment. If all her research thus far was correct then she didn't think there was a way to shrink them back down to normal size. It wasn't a normal jutsu that could just be released. She focused back on the elders and said, "And the second option?"

Homura looked deadly serious as he said, "The only other option...is to kill them."

Tsunade's eyes widened as she heard this. Could they really be serious? How could she eliminate the others? She shook her head slowly and said, "That is completely out of the question. I will not have any members of this village killed."

Koharu stared coldly at Tsunade and said, "As Hokage you are responsible for the wellbeing of the village. If killing a few means the salvation of many then those few should be sacrificed for the greater good."

Tsunade did not like this talk of "greater goods". It sounded like a terrible excuse to easily solve a problem. She continued talking, "I still won't. There has to be a better way. The giants and the normal people of the village can learn to live together. It'll take time, but it can be done."

Homura frowned and said, "And in the meantime, what if the Akatsuki attack again? What if more giants are turned against us? If we kill the giants we have now they won't be able to turn against us."

"And likewise they won't be able to help us!" Tsunade said getting frustrated. "Any male can be made into a giant, even normal people. An army of normal males at a massive size could be just as dangerous as a giant ninja. If we have some giants we at least have protection!"

Koharu shook her head and said, "You are as stubborn as Sarutobi was. But in the end he too came around. You will as well."

With those strange words, the two elders left Tsunade. As Tsunade was being ordered to do the impossible, Itachi, Kisame, and Tobi were heading back to the Akatsuki's hideout.

"Wow, this is so exciting!" Tobi said running behind Itachi. "You're so amazing Itachi!"

Kisame laughed and said, "Looks like you have a fan Itachi."

Itachi said nothing. He pulled out a kunai instead and threw it at Tobi. Tobi barely dodged it in time yelling out, "Hey! Watch it!"

Itachi stopped running, facing Tobi in a clearing. Kisame stopped as well and said, "Itachi what's wrong? Why are you attacking the kid?"

Itachi turned slowly to look at Kisame. "We've been working together for a long time Kisame. But I can no longer go along with this man's work."

Kisame looked confused as Itachi said this. "You're as clear as ever..."

Tobi laughed nervously and said, "What's all this about Itachi? What work? I just barely joined the Akatsuki."

Itachi ignored Tobi and continued talking to Kisame. "Go back to the cave. This doesn't concern you. If you stay, you may learn more than you want."

Kisame snorted and said, "Whatever. If that's the way it's going to be, then fine. I'll leave."

With that Kisame left, leaving Itachi and Tobi alone. Itachi closed his eyes and said, "After all these years I've finally got the means to kill you."

Tobi held up his hands and said hurriedly, "Why do you want to kill me? Tobi's a good boy!"

Itachi opened his eyes revealing his Mangekyo Sharingan. "Enough of this charade. We both know who you are Madara Uchiha. I sent Kisame away for a reason."

Tobi lowered his hands slowly and said, "Well I can't say I'm surprised. I always knew you'd try something like this eventually. Do you really think that you can defeat me?"

Itachi shook his head. "Alone, no. I'm sure you haven't revealed the extent of your powers to me and have a few tricks left to show. But with the three giants on my side I don't see how you can stand against me."

Madara laughed and said, "You really think I couldn't see this coming? Well then, let's see how the power of Itachi Uchiha matches with the power of Madara Uchiha."

Both stared at each other, Sharingan's active, waiting for the other to make the first move.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: An Impossible Choice and a Fight of Fate

choices: A way to forcibly shrink people (a take off of Akimichi jutsus)
The fourth was working on his own growth dust and antidote. . . .
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
While the Uchia were staring each other down, Tsunade was sitting in her den. A heavy sigh came before she closed her eyes and pulled out a bottle of sake. Soon followed a cup to drink. She gently poured the liquid into the cup and waited. She stared at the drink and the smooth surface on top of it, her reflection staring back at her. She couldn't kill the giants. She knew that. Besides the strategic loss, losing people like Kakashi and Asuma at this time and age would be one of the worst things. And then to lose hopeful promising ninja like Naruto, Shikamaru, and a few of the others would be detrimental to the future.

"They sound like Orochimaru," Tsunade said before putting a drink down when she heard clapping. Tsunade looked up and saw Jiraiya had infiltrated her den without her sensing it.

"You must be really focused on what those two old farts had to say," Jiraiya said, walking forward with a bag on his back, "To not have a drink."

"You heard?" Tsunade asked.

"Yes," Jiraiya said sitting down, "They're scared and wrong. The 3rd Hokage would never of done something like that. He loved every man, woman, and child like his own. He could accept them dying in battle. But slaughtering comrades was far lower than he would allow."

"But what do we do?" Tsunade asked, "I mean, I've looked over every scroll, every medical book on a way to reverse it, to help the situation. The closest I got was a way to forcibly shrink and grow certain aspects of the body in a permanent nature!" Tsuande looked away quickly realizing what she said.

"So that's how you got those 'two friends'?" Jiraiya asked.

"Shut up or I'll punch you," Tsunade said.

"All right," Jiraiya said, taking some things from his backpack.

"What's in that?" Tsunade asked.

"Well, this stuff was meant to go to Naruto when he gets older and more mature," Jiraiya said, "But I doubt the Fourth would mind us using it in a way to help save him." And from the bag, Jiraiya pulled scrolls of notes, data, and ideas for possible jutsus the 4th Hokage had written. Though some were incomplete, every idea was conceived in away that wasn't how Tsunade thought.

"Do you think any of this will help?" Tsunade asked.

"It may. He's like his son: Always thinking out of the box," Jiriaya said as he finished emptying the bag, "Let's get to work." Tsunade nodded and started reading.

After an hour passed and some scrolls were quickly finished, like "Way to summon ramen on missions" jutsu was tossed quickly. But eventually, Tsunade said, "I found something."

"What is it?" Jiraiya asked.

What did Tsunade find?
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: A third option from the Fourth?

choices: Jiraiya delivers the scroll to someone
Itachi and Madara continue to fight
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"It's strange...the Fourth Hokage must've had experience with this jutsu or saw it performed before. He has detailed notes on how to create a scroll and it looks like he was halfway through creating a kind of antidote. I can probably recreate it but it won't be perfect."

Jiraiya smiled and said, "Well that's something at least. How effective will it be?"

Tsunade pulled out a pen and made some quick calculations on the scroll. After a few minutes of hasty scribbling she said, "I'll be able to shrink our own ninja anytime they might get unruly. It looks like the Fourth was trying to make it so he could shrink giants that were created by other dust but never was able to finish it. In other words I'll be able to shrink all the giants that have my dust in them but not that have the Akatsuki's dust in them."

Jiraiya's smile became rather fixed as he said, "Well...that still solves half the problem. As long as we make it clear that giants can't defect and use their power against us the elders don't have a case against us."

Tsunade set this scroll aside slowly and started sifting through the rest of the scrolls that was in the bag. She was no longer just looking to look but was actively searching for something specific. Jiraiya noticed this and said, "Looking for something special?"

Tsunade nodded and said, "That scroll that described the Fourth's attempts to make the growing scroll got me thinking. He understood the whole jutsu concept and had known enough to make an antidote. What if he managed to make a growth scroll but never used it or talked about it since he didn't have a full antidote for it?"

Jiraiya's eyes widened and he said, "That could both advantageous and dangerous. The Fourth Hokage was a powerful ninja. If he did manage to make a growth scroll..."

He let that idea linger in the air. He started sifting with Tsunade through the various scrolls, notes, and books both anxious to find the scroll if it existed. After about ten minutes of searching Tsunade pulled out a very familiar looking scroll. Jiraiya stared at it and said, "That's it isn't it?"

Tsunade nodded and said, "This is definitely a growth scroll from the Fourth Hokage himself."

Jiraiya stood up and said, "What are we going to do with it?"

Tsunade stood up as well, holding the scroll with the care of holding a bomb. She wasn't sure what she wanted to do with it. It was just like with the last growth scroll she made. It was too dangerous to use but even more dangerous to leave alone. The bonds of the village still hadn't been fully healed and the Akatsuki were still at large, waiting to make their move against the village. The main worry was how powerful was this scroll? The Fourth was an amazing ninja to be sure. What if he knew it was too powerful and specifically didn't use it? If she did use it, it was sure to prove a powerful asset for the village.

The pros outweighed the cons at this point. She had to be extremely careful who she chose to use this scroll on. Since it was made with the Fourth Hokage's chakra she wouldn't be able to forcibly shrink whoever she used it on. At least not yet. She handed the scroll to Jiraiya and said, "We're going to have to use it. Will you deliver it?"

Jiraiya nodded and said, "Who are we giving it too?"

Tsunade shook her head and said, "I haven't decided yet. Let's discuss our options first."
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: A Gift From the Fourth

choices: Kakashi gets the scroll & they move out/The elders arn't unified about the plan
Itachi's three come to the battle and attack Tobi
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Jiraiya was careful with the scroll as he pocketed it. "All right, we'll need someone to use this on who the elders would agree to the fact he'd never go rouge," Jiraiya said.

"That excludes most of the genin," Tsunade said, "Naruto, Lee, and Shino's loyalty I don't doubt. Just their actions might be dangerous. Gaara's out because he isn't from this village."

"Iruka and Shikamaru are large and loyal. Even if smaller, together they could take out Kankuro," Jiraiya said, "That leaves Asuma and Kakashi."

"Considering both their histories, neither would go rouge and both would be smart in using their new found power," Tsunade said.

"Who do you think is the better choice?" Jiraiya asked.

"A sharigan can hypnotize an opponent. Only another Sharigan can counter it," Tsunade said, "I say Kakashi."

"I agree," Jiraiya said. "Funny we chose him and he's the only living member of the 4th's first genin squad." Jiraiya walked to the door. "Good luck with those two," Jiraiya said before leaving, "And watch out if Danzo's also around."

"I want Kakashi to grow far outside the village. You, Kakashi, Iruka, and Shikamaru are to go after those ninja. I want them incapacitated," Tsunade said.

"No medical ninja?" Jiraiya asked.

"No. All are needed here. Plus I'm the most successful in this operation," Tsunade said. "I'll come to you once things calm down here." Jiraiya nodded and went to find Kakashi.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: The choices before them

choices: Madara finishes Itachi off and escapes with the giants
Team Kakashi arrives on the scene to save the giants
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As the Leaf shinobi continued to fortify their defenses and heal the bonds between the people and Team Kakashi set out to use the scroll and subdue the three forcibly rouge ninja, Madara and Itachi were still fighting. The fight in its first rounds had consisted entirely of genjutsu. To any spectators it would've looked like the two Uchiha were simply staring at each other. Scenario after scenario of each other's deaths ran through their minds, clones fought, limbs were severed, scenery was destroyed, and other nameless terrible things chased the two fighters. Eventually Madara managed to push Itachi to the limit of genjutsu and forced both fighters back into visible reality. Itachi was breathing heavily, his body tiring more quickly than normal. His eyes flicked to the sides and three ninja suddenly appeared. Before Madara knew what was happening, the three ninja grew to twenty five, fifty, and seventy five feet piling on top of the oldest Uchiha one after another. The three giants swiftly moved aside following Itachi's mental orders. Itachi walked over to where Madara had been standing and found that nothing was there except a crater. He turned around and blocked the attack that came from behind Madara still quite alive. Madara laughed and said, "Well this has been fun, but it's all over now."

Madara jumped back and glared at the three giants in turn, his eye taking on the unmistakable look of Mangekyo. Within seconds, the three giants walked over to Madara and got behind him. Madara laughed again and said, "My Mangekyo holds the most powerful ability of any Sharingan. It has the ability to cancel any other technique used by a Sharingan. Any techniques you may use relating to the Sharingan fail if I so will it."

Itachi's expression remained impassive as he said, "You can't bluff me Madara. The technique used to create those giants was not a Sharingan ability. I don't know if what you say about your eyes are true, but I do know that you merely hypnotized those three. They are still under my control."

Madara shook his head and said, "You really think any jutsu you use could overcome the power of my eyes? You're a powerful opponent Itachi, but you're no match for me."

Itachi started walking forward and said, "We'll see."

His gaze turned to the other three ninja and their eyes locked. Slowly, the ninja started walking back toward Itachi. They were halfway to Itachi when Madara sighed and said, "And this is where I prove my eye's power."

Madara flashed his gaze upon the unfortunate ninja and they instantly walked back to him. It seemed his words had not been a lie. Madara's Mangekyo was stronger than Itachi's. Therefore his hypnosis was stronger than Itachi's. Not only that, but with all his eye techniques useless in the face of Madara and with no giants to help protect him Itachi was in serious trouble.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Madara's Power

choices: They help Itachi now and Madara is beaten.  Itachi surrenders.
They wait, Itachi dies and the power of Madara is truly formidable
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
A half hour earlier, just after the rescue team departed, Jiraiya presented Kakashi with the scroll. Kakashi would be lying if he told his comrades he was both excited and worried at the same time as he carried the 4th's scroll in his pocket as Team J moved through the woods. He, like Jiraiya, knew the 4th Hokage in ways no one else did. So knowing he made a growth scroll only made him wonder how close an eye he kept on Orochimaru and how lond did it take Orochimaru to perfect his jutsu?

"All right, we're far enough from the village," Jiraiya said, "Kakashi, use the scroll."

"Right," Kakashi said, pulling out the scroll. There was a moment of reverence as Kakashi held the scroll. IN a quick flash, he opened the scroll and a beautiful color of yellow sprayed onto him. With his sharigan eye, Kakashi saw that this dust was truly fine. It was so fine, to someone who didn't know it was dust would think it was pollen from flowers. Iruka, Shikamaru, and Jiraiya held their breath as Kakashi sky rocketed upwards.

"Wow, this feeling is amazing," Kakashi thought as he grew taller and taller. Iruka, like Naruto before, grew to be a benchmark for Kakashi's new height. But Kakashi quickly dwarfed Iruka and continued higher and higher. From his 180 foot max, Kakashi stopped finally at 6300 feet tall, 35 times his original size and over 1 mile tall. Kakashi quickly shrunk back to his old size.

"Holy crap," Shikamaru said, "You were huge."

"I'm almost scared to wonder how tall I would of been if some had gotten on me," Iruka said.

"Oh a a little under 4.5 miles high," Kakashi said before they continued on their way. The surrounding forest destroyed from Kakashi's feet and legs. The team was very lucky in many ways. Not only for having a good person to use the scroll on, but that Itachi and Madara never sensed the earth shaking due to them fighting with genjutsu at the time.

At the size of 20 feet, and carrying Jiraiya, the big three quickly found the missing giants due to the noise of them walking back and forth between Madara and Itachi.

When they arrived, they shrunk and were hidden, And over heard the following part of their conversation.

"You can't bluff me Madara. The technique used to create those giants was not a Sharingan ability. I don't know if what you say about your eyes are true, but I do know that you merely hypnotized those three. They are still under my control."

Madara shook his head and said, "You really think any jutsu you use could overcome the power of my eyes? You're a powerful opponent Itachi, but you're no match for me."

Itachi started walking forward and said, "We'll see."

His gaze turned to the other three ninja and their eyes locked. Slowly, the ninja started walking back toward Itachi. They were halfway to Itachi when Madara sighed and said, "And this is where I prove my eye's power."

"Oh man, that other guy has a sharigan?" Shikamaru asked, "What are we going to do now?"

"Well, we could either help Itachi, since he looks like he's on his last leg or wait for the other guy to finish him off and then move in," Jiraiya said.

"If we go now, you Shikamaru should bind all but Itachi as we move in. I'll go after that Madara, while Iruka grabs Itachi from behind," Kakashi said.

"And I'll support Kakashi," Jiraiya said, "So, should we move in?"
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: The power of the 4th Hokage's scroll

choices: The fight begins. Madara is merciless.
Team J manages to subdue the giants and Madara takes his leave.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"I don't think we should go in now." Shikamaru said. "We know Itachi is really powerful and this Madara guy looks even stronger. We should just wait for awhile. Madara will likely kill Itachi and then we can move in with the element of surprise."

"But what if Madara is too powerful for us to beat?" Iruka said. "We might need Itachi's help."

"I don't think we have to worry about Madara." Kakashi said. "What can he do if I just grow to my max height and crush him?"

That seemed to decide it. They waited it out. The fight was brutal. Itachi sent waves of black fire at Madara all of which were destroyed by Madara's eyes. Itachi tried to send the fire at the giants but Madara was far too fast for that. Itachi soon realized his eyes were useless in this fight and switched tactics. He pulled out a smoke bomb and tossed it at Madara. It exploded blinding him for a few seconds before the smoke dissipated. Itachi used those few seconds to send three clones up to the giants' face. As soon as they touched their skin, they exploded pushing them back. Itachi then caught the three giants in a genjutsu and forced them to attack Madara before he could cancel the illusion. Itachi frowned as he saw Madara's body phasing in and out dodging the attacks with ease. The giants were soon back under Madara's power. Madara walked forward and said, "Enough of these games Itachi.It's time I showed the second power of my Sharingan."

Itachi walked forward to meet Madara, ready to fight with whatever Madara through at him. Madara's eye flashed and, faster than even Itachi could follow, a force smashed into Itachi creating an enormous crater in the ground. Madara walked to the edge of the crater and saw that Itachi seemed to missing.

"How disappointing. I wasn't even using a quarter of my power. I thought for sure Itachi would survive for at least another few minutes."

Madara turned to leave and found himself face to face with Itachi. Madara smiled under his mask and said, "What a surprise. How did you survive?"

Itachi said, "My most powerful defense. Susano."

Madara's eye narrowed and said, "I see. How did you accomplish that?"

Itachi continued, "Your eyes can cancel any Sharingan technique. I knew that, yet I had a theory. If your were using your eye to attack, could you cancel my own techniques? That's your Sharingan's weakness."

Madara clapped his hands and said, "Bravo Itachi. You've managed to see my eyes one weakness. But our time together is now over. You were a worthy opponent as I expected."

Itachi jumped back as a ghostly skeletal figure appeared behind him. Madara's eye once again flashed and Itachi moved forward, the sword from Susano aimed at Madara, ready to trap him in an eternal genjutsu. The sword stopped inches from Madara as the unseen force smashed down on Itachi again. Susano stood no chance. It smashed as easily as if it were a shadow clone and Itachi was once again forced deep into a crater. This crater was much larger and much deeper, burrowing straight down into the ground, the bottom lost to darkness. Madara knew that this time Itachi was through. He turned to his giants and said, "Alright boys, let's get back to the hideout."

Before he could move, Team J sprang into action. Kakashi and Jiraiya moved to subdue Madara while Shikamaru and Iruka went for the giants. Madara easily dodged the attack and said, "My, my, my. If it isn't the Leaf shinobi."

Kakashi turned back around to face Madara and said, "You don't stand a chance against us Madara. Prepare to die."

Madara tilted his head and said, "Oh dear. You have no idea what you're dealing with do you?"
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: A Taste of Madara's Power

choices: The remaining Akatsuki meet up/Things are going well in Konoha
The elders want to shrink every giant w/ Tsunade's new cure/Pain & Tobi chat
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Shikamaru was quick to bind the three giants as he grew to 600 feet. Iruka went to his max and quickly attacked Kankuro by nailing several nerve and his five unprotected areas These were is eyes, ears, nose, throat and groin as none of them had any muscular protection. With all five hit near simultaneously, Kankuro dropped from the pain. Shikamaru turned his head when Iruka did the same strikes to Choji and Kiba. In mere moments, the three giants were incapacitated.

"Impressive double team," Madara said, looking at Iruka and Shikamaru.

"You're opponents are us," Kakashi said, growing large and focusing his sharigan on Madara. Madara laughed.

"You think you're borrowed sharigan can match up against mine?" Madara asked before he was struck by Jiraiya wielding a rasengan. But Madara merely fazed through the attack.

"What?" Jiraiya said, before realizing what happened, "Impressive defense."

"Thank you," Madara replied. It was then he felt himself being compressed into one spot and looked up at the 1000 foot Kakashi. His sharigan had gone into its mangekyou form. Mardara laughed again. In a quick moment, he vanished.

"Where did he go?" Kakashi thought.

"You have done well with that sharigan of yours," Madara said, now standing on a tree branch, "To honor your advancement, I'll take my leave." Madara coughed and rolled his head before going back to his Tobi voice, "Now have a swell day all you Leaf Shinobi! I don't think Boss-sama will try growing any more of your people for a while. You guys are just to big to deal with!" And in another blink, Tobi left to the main hideout. Kakashi went down to 800 feet tall as Jiraiya went to Itachi.

"My god, you're alive," Jiraiya said, looking at Itachi, "Who was that man?" Itachi opened one eye and looked at Jiraiya. The Toad sage immediately realized he was in a genjutsu. Next to him was Itachi, but standing before him was a healed Itachi.

"With the last of my strength, I will answer your question," Itachi said, "As ordered by the 3rd Hokage."

"The 3rd?" Jiraiya asked. Itachi nodded and went on to explain how the Uchiha clan was planning a coup. How Itachi was picked as a double agent, that he was to slaughter every Uchiha to stop it, but couldn't kill his brother. How Madara was a near ageless man and the only way to beat him was for someone to take Itachi's eyes and put them on another Sharigan warrior.

"And that is what you need to know," Itachi said before the healthy one vanished and the dying one's eye closed for the last time.

"We need to get back to the village now," Jiraiya said to the giants, "That guy is above any of us." The giants nodded and Kakashi picked up Kankuro, while Shikamaru and Iruka got Choji and Kiba.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Itachi's final words

choices: The Akatsuki decide their next move
The Leaf Village is allowed a moment of peace
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As Team J transported the three giants back to the Leaf Village, the remaining members of Akatsuki were joining together to discuss their next move. Pain looked around and saw that there were only a handful of members left. Zetsu, Tobi, Konan, Kisame, Kakuzu, and himself were all that were left. Deidara, Sasori, and Itachi had been killed by the Leaf ninja while Hidan's head had been stolen and his body sold for cash. Things were looking grim indeed for the organization. Pain sighed and said, "Perhaps we have underestimated the tenacity of the Leaf shinobi. I think it would be best if we didn't try to convert them with the scroll. We have to think of a way to gain more power without worrying about losing that power to the Leaf village."

"Well, the obvious choice is to make one of us giants." Kakuzu said. "That way we can guarantee that no one will go rouge on us or get converted back to the Leaf village."

Kisame laughed and said, "Yeah, good luck finding one of us who will be willing to stick our necks out taking on all the Leaf giants single handedly."

Tobi laughed with Kisame and said, "Besides do you know how big their biggest giant is? At least 1000 feet tall! How could we possibly stop that?"

"Maybe we could try a surprise attack." Zetsu said. "Something the Leaf village won't expect or be able to retaliate with."

"A human shield," Konan said, "Or a bargaining chip would be best."

"Yeah, someone who's close to the Leaf shinobi. Someone who would cause the whole village to mobilize to save."

"Hmmm...I still think there are far too many giants of the Leaf village. We should focus our efforts on finding a way to shrink them." Pain said.

Tobi straightened up suddenly and raised a hand into the air. "Ooh! Ooh! Leader-sama! Call on me! Oh please!"

Pain sighed and said, "What is it Tobi?"

Tobi excitedly said, "I did some spying in the Leaf village while Itachi was creating giants and I overheard people talking about when Orochimaru was attacking. Orochimaru had made a scroll that forced the giants to fight and the loser would shrink while the winner would steal their size! Maybe we can do something like that?"

The suggestions kept coming from all sides, each one with its own pros and cons. While the Akatsuki discussed their next move, Tsunade was finishing healing Kankuro, Kiba, and Choji returning them to their normal size and sending them back to the hospital. All in all, the Leaf village was once again prospering. Tsunade and Shizune had been healing the bonds of the village all the while Team J was going after the three rouge giants and their efforts had not been in vain. It had been easy to convince the giants to stick together and not make trouble for the village. The real challenge had been in convincing the villagers that the giants were an invaluable asset to the village. She had done this by showing how helpful Naruto could be. Just by going along with whatever Tsunade told him to do was a big help in convincing the villagers. If Naruto could be kept under control, his strength channeled to help and heal the village, then anyone could. Tsunade also set certain laws into effect specifically concerning the giants, namely that they could only be a certain size when they were in the village proper and that they were responsible for any damage caused to the village that was directly connected to them. Things like this helped the village accept the giants as good and helpful rather than evil and damaging. There were still those who bore grudges but not all healing can be done in a single day. The village was on its way at least.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Regroup and Heal

choices: Teuchi, Itachi's spy, tries destroying Itachi's body /Elders keep quiet
One elder is willing to speak / Akatsuki finalize plans
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Dawn of the next day brought a day that hadn't been seen since before the Orochimaru's first scroll appeared. With Tsunade's healing going on, and no likely strike by the Akatsuki, both people and giants were getting along very well. In different parts of the village, people were bonding in their own way.

Naruto and Sasuke, working under Sakura's direction, were helping repair the damage done by Kiba's run.

"You guys are doing great!" Sakura yelled at the two twenty foot giants.

"Thanks," Sasuke said, lifting some debris. Naruto and his shadow clones also picked some up.

"This isn't half as bad as I thought it'd be," Naruto said.

"Yeah, because Sakura's invited us over to eat at her house once again," Sasuke thought. But if it got Naruto working with him, he'd have no qualms about the motivation.

Near the main gate of the vilage, Shikamaru was escorting Temari to where she'd meet up with her brothers and her jounin-sensei.

"I didn't get a chance yesterday to say thank you," Temari said as they walked down the street.

"For saving your brother?" Shikamaru asked.

"Yeah," Temari said, "What you did will go along way in helping good relations between our villages." Shikamaru nodded, but felt that this wasn't the only relationship she was commenting on.

"Probably," Shikamaru said before Temari stopped.

"Just around this corner's the main gate, right?" Temari asked.

"Yeah," Shikamaru replied, he thought Temari already knew this. Suddenly Temari leaned in and kissed Shikamaru on the lips.

"Stay strong you big lazy fool," Temari said before going around the corner.

"Temari, what are you blushing about?" Gaara asked his sister.

"None of your business," Temari replied in her normal tone. Shikamaru was smart not to continue following her around the corner as Kankuro looked that way before they departed back to Suna.

Team Guy, once again at a restaurant, was also enjoying some bonding time.

"Oh Neji, I am so sorry for my hubris! And for making you feel umbrage against me!" Lee said as they ate some food.

"Lee, two things," Neji said taking a napkin to his face, "One, you already apologized to me today."

"And thirty times yesterday," Tenten added in.

"Second, if you're still going to do it, don't have food in your mouth," Neji finished. Lee swallowed.

"Right," he said. "I am so happy that we are getting along once again!"

"Yes my wonderful students, you truly are bonding nicely," Guy said, "But the best way to ensure you bond completely with each other is for you to wear each others' underwear!" Neji and Tenten nearly choked on their food. Both exchanged glances and knew to get out of there before it was too late.

"Oh wonderful idea Guy-sensei! I'll take mine off right now!" Lee shouted loud enough for the entire place to hear. "Wait, I forgot to wear some today," Lee said right before he dropped his pants. Neji and Tenten looked at each other again. It was too late, for them because they realized deep down, they truly weren't bothered by this anymore. And that is something that really scared them.

Jiraiya smiled as he once again looked through the village and seeing all the bonding and healing going on. With Team 7 being the corner stone of Tsunade's plan, it worked very well. He was also lucky to catch Temari's kiss to Shikamaru. He made note of it and would add that to his next Icha Icha book "Big Lovers". As he passed Team Asuma, they were enjoying a nice meal at the Bar B Que.

"Now if we could only get those damn elders to talk about what Itachi was saying," Jiraiya thought as he went to Tsunade's where she was meeting with them right now. And in the hospital morgue, there were 10 ANBUs lead by Kakashi, protecting Itachi's remains from anyone who might try destroying the body for any reason.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Bonding

choices: Teuchi doesn't destroy Itachi's body/the Akatsuki finalize their plans
Teuchi does destroy Itachi's body/the elders still won't talk
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As the Leaf village enjoyed it's moment of piece, Teuchi's final order from Itachi was taking effect in his mind. Itachi had planned ahead in case he wasn't able to kill Madara. When his life ended, the order that was hidden in the back of Teuchi's mind sprang forward and took control. Itachi didn't want any part of his body being found by the Akatsuki or used by the elders of the Leaf village. He made sure to tell Jiraiya that his eyes needed to be implanted in a Sharingan user if they were to be able to take on Madara. He had made sure to make it sound urgent for this specific purpose. By this time Itachi had expected his eyes to have been removed and given to Sasuke since he was the only other full blooded Sharingan user left besides Madara himself. Kakashi might work in a pinch, but his single Sharingan wouldn't be as effective against Madara as Sasuke's Eternal Mangekyo would be.

Unfortunately, Itachi's eyes were still resting in his head, the operation to remove them and implant them in Sasuke still only an idea in Jiraiya's head. He never suspected Itachi of trying to have his own body destroyed so quickly. Teuchi turned to his daughter and said, "Ayame, I'm going to deliver some ramen to the ANBU at the hospital. Can you handle things here for awhile?"

"Of course!" Ayame said, smiling at her father.

Teuchi stockpiled as many lunch boxes as he could, heading for the hospital. Itachi had been very specific in his instructions. He knew that his body was going to be put under high surveillance until it was decided what to do with it. Teuchi was to use the ramen as a distraction.
