As soon as the lunch boxes were opened smoke bombs would go off casting the entire area into a smoke filled haze. At that time Teuchi was meant to plant incendiary bombs on Itachi's corpse, burning it until it was nothing but ash. It would only take a few seconds to accomplish the entire mission and Itachi's last secrets would be safe from everyone.

As Teuchi made his way to the hospital, Tsunade was talking with the elders about Itachi's last words. She had been trying for hours to wheedle the information out of them but they were steadfast.

"Why would Itachi say something like that at the end of his life? What could he have to hide? Is it true what he said?" Tsunade asked.

She had asked question after question in this vein but the answers had all been the same. Itachi was a known criminal trying to hide his crimes of the past by making something up on his death bed so he wouldn't be remembered as a criminal. He was trying to stall for time to use some last ditch attack to kill the surrounding Leaf ninja. On and on the back and forth went neither party giving any ground and the discussions getting absolutely nowhere.

Meanwhile, Teuchi was arriving at the morgue of the hospital, his trap prepared.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Spies and Lies

choices: Pein starts work on his own growth scroll / Danzo talks with Tsunade in private
The other Akatsuki meet in private to discuss other ideas/Dinner at Sakura's
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"Teuchi, what are you doing here?" Kakashi asked the ramen master as he approached.

"Well, to help the healing process, I've been giving out free ramen to on work shinobi," Teuchi said. When he got close to Kakashi, he whispered, "Also I'll have too much come the next shipment. Business has been real down lately. I need to get rid of my over stock." He gave an embarrassed laugh. Kakashi nodded

"I won't tell anyone," he said and accepted the 11 containers of ramen. Teuchi started back out as the ninja opened the containers. There was a blast of smoke and Teuchi turned around and burst through the doors. He saw Itachi's body and threw the incendiary bomb. The body ignited and Teuchi smiled as his master's face was burnt.

"Well, Kakashi was right," came a voice from behind Teuchi before he felt something wrap around him He saw wooden planks bond tightly around him as a twelfth ANBU came from the shadows. "A decoy body was needed after all," he said, looking at Teuchi. Kakashi soon entered the room.

"Decoy body? Then where's the real one?" Teuchi asked.

"Oh we won't be telling you that," Kakashi said, "But you'll be visited by Ibiki soon and we'll learn all about you and your work as Itachi's spy. We'll also need to bring in your daughter, Ayame for questioning as well." Teuchi said nothing, but felt some saddness his daughter was being dragged into this.

Elsewhere, at a cave where the Akatsuki were meeting, Pein sighed.

"So, in the past 24 hours, we got no where in terms of deciding what to do," Pein said, "The only thing we did agree on was to use our own servants or cause civil unrest between the normal people and the giants."

"But we never decided on how," Kazuku said. "If that's all, I'm going off to collect some more bounties." And in a flash, his projection vanished.

"I'm also out of here," Kisame said, "I have other things to do." Kisame also vanished.

"Pein-sama," Konan said finally, "You could always grow one of your other bodies. Then you'd be an even greater God."

"Kanon, that is a very good idea," Pain said.

"Good for him, not for me," Madara thought, "I'll need to convert some ninja to me if I want to fight him at a large scale."
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Decoys and duds

choices: Kisame and Kakuzu finish their growth scrolls and use them on Zetsu
Naruto, Sakura, and Sasuke find something to do together
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As Pain, Konan, and Tobi continued discussing plans with each other, the other Akatsuki members were meeting in private to discuss their own tactics. About ten miles away was another cave, this one deeper underground than the official Akatsuki hideout and this is where they were meeting. Kakuzu, Kisame, and Zetsu arrived within about five minutes of each other. When they were all there Kakuzu said, "So what are we going to do? Everything we've done so far has either ended up killing one of us or giving more power to the Leaf village. At this rate, the Leaf village will be able to police the entire country making any of our private exploits impossible."

Kisame shook his head and said, "You really only care about money don't you?"

Kakuzu shrugged and said, "There are worse things to be obsessed with."

Zetsu coughed and said, "Does anyone have any ideas at all?"

Kakuzu rubbed his face and said, "There has to be someway to obliterate the Leaf village quickly and silently. An attack from the sky or the sides or underground."

Kisame and Kakuzu both looked over at Zetsu. He looked from one to the other and said, "I don't know what you both think I'm capable of but there's no way I could destroy the entire Leaf village in one shot."

Kisame's suddenly widened and a sharkish grin rose on his face. "No you couldn't. At least...not at your current size..."

Kakuzu nodded and said, "That's something we never thought of before."

Zetsu looked slightly nervous as he said, "That sounds a little...desperate."

Kisame rolled his eyes and said, "Well as it is things are getting desperate. If we don't do something our leader is going to try another attack which is no doubt going to fail again possibly granting a Leaf giant even more size and power."

Zetsu sighed and said, "Well, do either of you even know how to make a growth scroll?"

Kakuzu pulled a scroll out of his robe and said, "I stole this awhile back when you first found Orochimaru's body. Sasori didn't even notice it missing. With this we could make a scroll."

Kisame grabbed the scroll and opened it. "Hmm...this looks a little complicated. This kind of jutsu really isn't my style."

Kakuzu sighed and said, "You're trying to pin all the work on me?"

Zetsu quickly said, "Don't even think of looking at me. I have no idea how it works."

Kisame tossed the scroll back to Kakuzu and said, "Well let's just both make a scroll and use them both on Zetsu. We're guaranteed to get some good size that way."

Kakuzu agreed and said, "Besides, we're not letting him go until he's big enough to swallow the Leaf Village in one shot."

Zetsu shook his head and said, "That's almost unimaginable."

Kisame grinned again and said, "Well you only need to get that big once. After that you don't ever have to get bigger than this if you don't want to. Now let's get started!"

As the remaining Akatuski members planned their fiendish plans, Sakura, Naruto, and Sasuke were gathering at Sakura's house for dinner. Sakura was making a variety of dishes including ramen for Naruto. As Sakura cooked, the boys sat at the kitchen table talking. Sasuke was staring out the window for about five minutes before Naruto said, "Something on your mind Sasuke?"

Sasuke looked at Naruto and said, "I was just thinking about Itachi. I always lived my life seeking the chance to kill him and now that he's dead, I don't know what to do."

Naruto snorted and said, "Is that it? Why don't you start rebuilding your clan? That always should have been priority number one in my opinion."

Sasuke sighed and said, "Do you know what I have to do to revive my clan? I'm a little young for that right now."

Naruto tilted his head and said, "Whatever. I don't really know what you're talking about, but there's always other things you can do. Revenge is a stupid reason to live anyway."

Sakura turned from the stove and said, "I agree with Naruto on this one Sasuke. You're better off now that Itachi is dead."

Sasuke still didn't know the truth about his brother. He still thought of him as a cold blooded murder rather than a hero of the Leaf village. The time would come when he would be told, probably by Kakashi, when he was older and could except the truth. Until then, he'd just have to find another purpose to his life. Ten minutes later Sakura was handing out the dinner and everyone stopped talking to start eating. The meal passed quietly without much talk interrupting it. When it was over Sakura set the dishes in the sink and said, "I'll take care of those later. What do you guys want to do now?"

Naruto, leaning back in his chair, said, "Hmm...I don't know. I don't really feel like training after all the fighting we've been doing lately and we just ate so I'm at a loss for ideas."

Sasuke smirked and said, "Is fighting and eating all you ever think about?"

Naruto jumped up and said, "Oh like your constant revenge talk and dark brooding was any better?"

Sakura got between the two boys and said, "Now don't you start! The last thing I need is my house destroyed by a giant squabble!"

Both boys sat down again and Sakura sighed, sitting down as well. Things hadn't changed all that much after all.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Secret Meeting and Dinner

choices: Naruto, his hands were full
Hinata, she had been watching them for awhile / Naruto returns with the game
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"I know what we can do!" Naruto said, standing up, "I have a board game at my house. I'll be right back." Naruto walked to the door and came back in.

"That was fast," Sasuke said, "Where's the game?"

"I sent a shadow clone after it," Naruto said.

"So, what game did you think of?" Sakura asked.

"Well, two actually," Naruto said, "Konoha-opoly and Risk." Both his teammates blinked.

"Why do you have those games Naruto?" Sakura asked.

"Well, I got them when I was younger with some of the cash Iruka would give me for groceries and ramen. I got them in case I had friends over and we wanted to play something," Naruto confessed. Though he kept a smile on is face, both Sasuke and Sakura could feel the sadness of remembering being alone with no one around.

"I guess we can play with them," Sasuke said, "Besides, both can be seen as training, since you need to know how to spend your resources wisely in each."

"Oh good point Sasuke!" Sakura said as her front received a knock. "Naruto, your clones don't have to knock to come back in." Sakura stood up and went to the front door.

Who was there?
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Board games for the bored

choices: The night passes peacefully as the four genin play a board game
Something happens in the night...
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As Sakura opened the door she was surprised to see Hinata standing on her front steps, her eyes turned down.

"Oh Hinata!" Sakura said in surprise. "What are you doing here?"

Oh what a loaded question that was. In truth, Hinata had been following the group around watching them from the shadows. She loved to watch Naruto work, whether it be at his normal size or his giant size (She had almost fainted once when he was working without his shirt on, all his giant muscles flexing). But she couldn't say that to Sakura. She couldn't say, "I've been stalking you for the past few days because I want to watch Naruto and wish I could be a part of his group of friends." So what could she say? Finally, she decided on something.

"I've been very lonely lately since Kiba and Shino are always working on rebuilding the village. I don't have anyone to talk to or just be with and so I was wondering if I could come in with you guys?"

That at least was partly true. Kiba and Shino had both been pretty busy but Kiba at least seemed like he was trying to make time for Hinata. But now that he was in the hospital all she had for company was Shino and all he wanted to do was go around looking for bugs when he wasn't working. She waited with bated breath, hoping Sakura would say yes.

Sakura smiled at the timid girl and said, "Sure! Come on in."

Hinata smiled back and said, "Thank you very much!"

She walked inside and Sakura closed the door behind her. When they got back to the kitchen, Naruto grinned as he saw Hinata and said, "Hey Hinata! What's up?"

Hinata blushed furiously and managed to stutter out, "N-not much Naruto."

Naruto tilted his head at Hinata's behavior and said, "Weird." quietly to himself. Sasuke just raised a hand as a greeting. Sakura pulled out a chair next to Naruto and said, "Come on and sit down. Naruto just sent out a shadow clone to get some board games for us to play."

Hinata actually looked cheerful as she heard this. "That sounds like fun!"

Naruto smiled at her and said, "How good are you at Risk or Konoha-opoly?"

Hinata replied, "I've never played Risk but I'm pretty good at Konoha-opoly. Is Risk hard?"

Sasuke shrugged and said, "That depends on how good you are at strategy games. You have to know where to send your armies and how many soldiers you want to attack your enemies. You also have to be careful that you don't bog down units of your army in weak countries or get them stuck trying to cross a river. That'll just leave open targets for your enemies."

"Sounds hard." Hinata said. "But I'll try it."

"Yeah, if Naruto can play it you shouldn't have any trouble!" Sakura said, laughing.

"Hey! That's not fair!" Naruto shrieked angrily.

Everyone laughed at this (except for Sasuke of course. But he still smiled). Suddenly, the door burst open and Naruto's shadow clone came running in with two board games clutched in his hands. He set the boxes down and disappeared in a puff of smoke. Naruto unstacked the boxes and said, "Alright, which one guys?"
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Hinata's Lonely Night

choices: Sakura says she does like Naruto
Sakura doesn't give a definite answer
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"Uh, I'll play what ever you want to play," Hinata said quietly.

"I say Risk," Sasuke said. Both Sakura and Naruto could of guessed that.

"Well, I say Konoha-opoly," Sakura said. While she was confident in working various armies in Risk, she didn't want to go up against Sasuke in it.

"So we're left with Naruto," Sasuke said, "I wonder which the fool will pick?" Naruto glared at Sasuke, but saw through his chide. He wanted to play Risk and probably have the advantage. Truthfully, Naruto did understand Risk as he's read the rules several times while alone. But Sakura wanted to play Konoha-opoly and he knew Hinata stood more of a chance there than at Risk.

"Well, I'd like to play Konoha-opoly," Naruto said.

"Figures," Sasuke said.

"Only because it was the first game I thought of," Naruto said, unpacking the game.

"Fine, dibs on the Kunia," Sasuke said.

"I'll take the Nin-dog," Sakura said.

"I like the ANBU mask," Hinata said.

"And I'll take the headband," Naruto said. With the tokens decided, Naruto set the board up on the circular table. They sat so Naruto was across from Sasuke. Hinata was on Naruto's right, and Sakura on the left.

"So, let's roll to see who goes first," Sakura said, rolling the dice. Sakura got 8. Sasuke then rolled and got a 7. Hinata took the dice and got 12.

"Nice roll Hinata," Naruto said.

"Thanks," Hinata said, timidly as she handed the dice to Naruto.

"Man I got 3!" Naruto said before handing Hinata the dice back. And since they would go counter-clockwise, Naruto would be last to roll. Sakura, as banker, handed out the funds.

"Here I go," Hinata said, rolling a 12 again. "Konoha Electric company," she said, "Uh, can we buy the first time around or not?"

"Sure," Naruto said. Sakura and Sasuke gave no objections.

"Okay," Hinata said, paying the money and rolling again. She got a 10 by 6 and 4. "Chance," Hinata said moving her token and pulling the orange card. "Move to nearest utility. May buy if unowned." Hinata moved to the water works and bought that as well.

"Wow, when you said you were good, you weren't kidding," Naruto said as Sasuke took the dice. Hinata blushed from the compliment as Sasuke rolled.

"Snake eyes," Sasuke said before looking at Naruto. "Don't even say it," Sasuke said before he pulled a Community Chest card. "Pay $150 for Academy tax. Darn it," Sasuke said handing the money over to Sakura. Sasuke rolled an 8, by 6 and 2.

"You go to visiting," Sakura said. Sasuke moved there and Sakura rolled.

"Yes 5!" Sakura said as she went to Main street and quickly bought it up. Naruto took the dice and got 3 again. He moved to Ichiraku Ramen and bought it up.

"Not bad," Naruto said, as it became Hinata's turn.

The game proceeded long into the night. Naruto, by many bad rolls, ended up landing on many of Hinata's properties and paying most of his money to her. Sakura was able to obtain all four Big Streets and took much of Sasuke's fortune, even after he got both Hokage's mansion and Damio's castle. Hinata was able to get the three second most costly properties, Hyuga Estates. A few more minutes passed and Naruto and Sasuke both had to retire as they went bankrupt. They both went in the same turn.

"All right, now it's just you and me," Sakura said, looking at Hinata.

"Yeah," Hinata said. While Hinata had fewer properties, she did have the two monopolies around the "Go to Jail" square and a few other scattered properties.

And so the battle of the Kunoichis began with them trading funds between each other as they landed on the others properties and buying up any of the boy's now owner-less property.

"Hey, why don't you guys call it quits and count your money?" Naruto asked as he and Sasuke cleaned up the dishes from dinner, four hours ago.

"Yeah, this isn't going to end very soon," Sakura said. Hinata nodded and started counting her money. Sakura did as well. "How much?"

"Without property, $783. With, $1252," Hinata said.

"Without property, $709. With $1306," Sakura said, smiling. "That was fun. Want to play again?"

"No!" both Naruto and Sasuke said together after finishing with the Kitchen. Both girls laughed at how both guys had the same expression on their face.

"No thank you," Hinata said yawning, "I need to get home."

"Why do spend the rest of the night?" Sakura asked.

"Can I stay as well?" Naruto asked.

"No," Sakura said.

"If you don't mind," Hinata said.

"I offered. Of course I wouldn't," Sakura said before looking at the guys. "I'll clean up the game and you can pick it up in the morning," Sakura said.

"All right," Naruto said, "See ya later!"

"Have a nice night," Sasuke said as both left.

"That was fun," Naruto said, "But man, Hinata was good with those dice."

"I wonder how good she'd of been if she was focused completely on the game," Sasuke said.

"What else was she focused on?" Naruto asked as they walked down the street. Sasuke just shook his head and bid Naruto good night.

Back with the girls, as they put on some night gowns, Hinata borrowing a set of Sakura's, Sakura looked at Hinata.

"So, you really like Naruto, don't you?" Sakura asked, putting a mat on her bedroom floor.

"Yes, do you?" Hinata asked. Sakura thought for a minute before answering.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: The night passes peacefully as the four genin p...

choices: The next morning the healing continues
One of the Akatsuki groups finalizes their plans
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As Sakura made up Hinata's mat she thought about her answer.

"Well, I don't think I like him in the same way you do. I mean, Naruto's one of my best friends and I know he likes me, but I just don't think our personalities match too well. Plus I have this...thing for Sasuke. I know he doesn't think of me that way either but I think he might change now that he doesn't have to focus on killing his brother."

Hinata felt a strange relief at hearing this. She had been under the impression that Sakura liked Naruto as much as she did. If it wasn't for Hinata's cursed shyness she would've admitted her feelings to Naruto long before this. But she just couldn't bring herself to say it. Every time she even started getting close the words would fumble in her mouth and Naruto would get bored or think she was weird and walk away or change the subject. If Sakura had liked Naruto then Hinata probably wouldn't have stood a chance. Sakura seemed to notice Hinata's relief and said, "Don't get me wrong though, something might pop up between us. Feelings change and maybe someday you won't even like Naruto as much as you do now."

Hinata shook her head and said, "No, I'll always feel this way about Naruto. I've never felt differently about him. I've just never been able to say what I feel. I just get so nervous."

Sakura patted her on the back and said, "It takes time to get up the courage to tell someone you love them. What you need is a friend to help you through it."

Hinata looked at Sakura in surprise and said, "You'll help me?"

Sakura nodded and said, "But I don't think it would do much good at this point. He's so obsessed with me I think you'd just turn him off by telling him you loved him out of the blue. Instead, you just have to be more open with him. Get to know him better."

Hinata nodded slowly, her heart beating faster just thinking about getting closer to Naruto. She lay down on the mat and said, "This is all so sudden. I-I don't know if I can handle this."

Sakura climbed into her own bed and said, "Don't worry about it. With me helping you it'll be a cinch."

Sakura turned out the light and pulled her blankets up high, moving lower down in bed to keep warm, sighing in contentment. Hinata sighed and looked up at the dark ceiling Naruto's face appearing out of the darkness. She blushed as she saw his usual grin and whispered, "Naruto..."

She sighed and turned on her side wondering what was going to happen in the coming days.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Sakura's Answer...Sort Of

choices: Tobi informs Pein what happened / Pein decides to attack Tobi
Tobi remains silent, distrust between the two/Teuchi repeats Itachi's story
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Dawn broke for Konoha. And the healing process between the giants and normal people continued.

"For the last time Lee! Put on some underwear!" Neji shouted, "And I mean your own!"

But far away, there were some bonds about to be broken.

Pein had finished making several scrolls to grow one of his other bodies, two if needed. So, as he awoke another body, he picked up the scroll in a attacking body and opened it up. Pein slowly rose in the air until he came to 60 feet tall.

"Hmm, five times larger," Pein said, "Konan, throw me another." His partner, Konan, threw the scroll and it burst open. Pein rose again, this scroll was one of the ones created later. Pein grew to the height of 540 feet tall.

"This will do," he said as his summoning body walked up to Konan to carry the scrolls. "Where's Madara?"

"He went off to find the other Akatsuki," Konan replied, as Pein shrunk down in size.

Elsewhere, Kakuzu and Kisame were worn out from making the scrolls.

"I still don't like this," white Zetsu said.

"Why? It could be fun. And once we're done, we won't have to listen to any of them again," black Zetsu said

"All right, let's get you growing," Kisame said.

"Aww, you had a secret party and didn't invite me?" came a voice from the shadows. Tobi emerged. "That's no fair!"

"Leave runt," Kakusu said.

"Why are you here?" white Zetsu asked.

"Well, we are supposed to follow Pein-sama's orders. But here you are, not doing it. Also you thought you could destroy me," Tobi said as his voice deepened to his Madara voice, "So now I'll have to kill you like I killed Itachi." The Kakusu and Kisame were shocked upon hearing this. Zetsu figured that's what happened.

"Why you," Kisame said. But nothing else was said from those Akatsuki as Amaterasu was smmmoned and burned them all to dust. Madara went forward and picked up Kisame and Kakuzu's scrolls and pocketed them.

"That was fun," Madara said, "I wonder if my lackey will try killing me?"
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Destroying the Akatsuki

choices: Tsunade confronts the elders
Madara creates a growth scroll
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Madara thought about what had just happened as he made his way back to the Akatsuki's hideout. It was bad enough they were losing members due to the Leaf ninja, now the remaining members were engaging in acts of treason and deceit. Now only three members of this once powerful and feared organization were left.

"Perhaps it is time that I make one of these scrolls..."

Yes, with his skill he would no doubt be able make a powerful scroll but who would he use it on? Could he still trust Pain and Konan? They had been the most loyal out of all the Akatsuki members, probably since they had the most control in the organization and he let them run the whole organization. Madara weighed his options as he entered the Akatsuki's hideout. Pain turned to look as he walked in and he said, "Did you find them Madara?"

Madara shook his head. "Wherever they are, they obviously don't want to be found."

Pain's eyes narrowed as he heard this. The two men just stared at each other, each trying to guess what the other was thinking, what the other was planning. Pain broke the contact first, turning back to Konan. "Very well. Then we should finish preparations for our attack on the Leaf Village. Once we do attack, we will destroy Konoha completely, leaving only the jinchuriki of the Kyuubi.After we destroy the village, we will move on to Suna and get the jinchuriki of the Shukaku sand spirit. The rest of the tailed beasts will fall one by one after that."

Madara slowly walked around the cave, listening to Pain talk. He was only half listening. He knew what Pain's plan was going to be. It was rather obvious. Madara had the instructions to make a growth scroll in his coat. He still wasn't sure if it was in his best interest to use it, but he was sure the giants of the Leaf Village had at least three giants that were far above Pain's height of 540 feet. If he did make a scroll it would have to powerful. Very powerful. It didn't help that Pain was starting to lose faith in him. Judging by his body language it seemed like he knew Madara was hiding something. Oh well. There would be time to deal with that later.

As the last of the Akatsuki planned their final attack, Teuchi was brought before Tsunade for questioning. Now that his last instructions had been completed, Teuchi had only one thing left to do before Itachi's control left him completely. Tsunade sat behind her desk listening as Teuchi retold the story of Itachi's life, confirming all the terrible events from his initial drafting as a double agent all the way to his own death at Madara's hands. The last thing Teuchi said was, "Itachi had been using me as a spy since he joined Akatsuki, hoping to keep an eye on Sasuke so that the elders didn't try and finish him off while he was away. He wanted it to be known that I was performing this task against my will and that I should not be punished for it."

Tsunade sighed and closed her eyes trying to take all this in. At least Sarutobi-sensei never agreed to the massacre Tsunade thought gratefully. It was all the elders fault. There's and Danzo's.

Teuchi suddenly sat up straight and said, "Excuse me Lady Hokage but why am I here again?"

Tsunade stared at Teuchi and realized he was telling the truth. Obviously Itachi's last vestiges of control were now gone. Tsunade assured him that she had just wanted to see him about some trivial matter. Within minutes he was gone back to Ichiraku to continue his business in peace. Tsunade folded her hands trying to keep her cool. Those bastard elders were liars. The worst kind of liars. They had been keeping secrets from the Leaf Village all these years. A coup...the Uchiha's had been planning on trying to take control of the Leaf Village by force. Those actions would've caused a mass civil war between the Uchiha and the other forces of the Leaf Village. Many would of died. Did it justify the massacre of the entire Uchiha clan? Itachi had thought so. So had the elders and Danzo. The Third Hokage had thought it was a bad idea. He hadn't wanted to go through with the massacre but the others overrode his own decisions. Regardless, it was all over. But the elders would have to answer to this. Tsunade got up and headed for their council chamber.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Trouble Among the Akatsuki and Tsunade's Answers

choices: Tsunade will let Sasuke decide their fate.
Pein attacks before anything else can happen.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As Tsunade walked down the hallway, Shizune was on approach, but quickly stopped. Shizune was paralyzed by the immense anger and killing intent in the Hokage's eyes.

"What could of happened to make her like that?" Shizune wondered as she pressed herself against the wall, waiting for Tsunade to pass and when she did, Shizune went to find other Jounin to warn them.

Elsewhere on a roof of a building, Jiraiya had been waiting to hear from his informants. He was waiting to hear about Akatsuki movements when he saw Tsunade pass a window in her mansion. When he saw her face, even for a moment, he knew there was trouble.

"I wonder if Teuchi confirmed Itachi's story. If he did. . . I better get in there," Jiraiya said departing his location.

Tsunade was within sight of the elder's room. As she took another step closer, she felt Jiraiya appear behind her.

"Go Jiraiya. Leave me," Tsunade said before continuing on. Jiraiya followed.

"I take it Teuchi confirmed everything I told you?" Jiraiya asked grimly.

"Yes, and I know this isn't some hoax either," Tsunade said.

"How so?" Jiraiya asked.

"It was how Teuchi repeated the words of the old man in his story," Tsunade said, "His words, his reactions were right on the spot. And it were things that no one but those who've seen that man under great stress and deliberation would of known."

"And now you want to go kill the three elders?" Jiraiya asked.

"No," Tsunade said, "I want to punish them. The entire slaughter of a clan is too far." She now stood before the doors. In a swift moment, she punched the doors and sent them across the room. Inside the chamber, Danzo, and the others were sitting.

"Tsunade, what's the meaning of this?" Koharu asked, seeing the two remaining Sannin standing before them and coming in.

"Breaking a door is far better a crime than murder of a clan," Tsunade said.

"We're back to that business again?" Homura asked, "I thought it was realized that Itachi was lying."

"Then why did his spy confirm every detail? Jiraiya asked, "Including actions by the Third. Actions that he would of only done when faced with an impossible choice?"

"It isn't that impossible," the cold and logical Danzo said, "For the greater good, some may need to be pushed away."

"So then you did order Itachi to do it," Tsunade asked.

"It was for the village. A civil war would of destroyed Konoha. You must see that," Homua said.

"That doesn't condone what you ordered done," Jiraiya said, "Neither the First or Second would of gone that far."

"It was because they joined with the Uchiha clan that we had this problem," Danzo said. "They were all power hungry and wanted more. Madara was the worst of them."

"I wouldn't be surprised if would of enjoyed watching the civil war from his grave," Koharu said.

"Uchiha Madara's alive," Jiraiya said, "He was the one who killed Itachi." For the first time in a long time, all three elders showed signs of surprise at hearing of Madara's health.

"That's not possible!" Homura said.

"Itachi called his murderer by that name and he had a sharigan," Jiraiya said. All three elders exchanged glances.

"So, what is the Hokage going to do to defend the village now?" Danzo asked.

"I will die to protect this village. If you were so concerned about it, you should of killed the Uchiha's yourself," Tsunade said. "But for now, I need to deal with your actions."
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Tsunade confronts the elders

choices: Sasuke decides the punishment
Pain attacks the village before the punishment
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Tsunade glared at the three elders, thinking about how best to punish them. An idea suddenly came to her and she acted on it. She turned to Jiraiya and whispered something in his ear. Jiraiya frowned and whispered something back. Tsunade gave him a dark look and nodded. Jiraiya turned and left. Tsunade turned back to the elders and said, "I've decided on the perfect way to punish you three."

"How dare you threaten us Tsunade." Koharu said softly. "After all we've done for this village since your grandfather started it. Have you no respect?"

Tsunade laughed harshly and said, "You three don't deserve respect. I'm going to make you think twice about trying something like this ever again."

Homura stared steadily at Tsunade and said, "What would you have done in the first place Tsunade? A war is on the village's doorstep. Two clans that had been at war since the very beginning. Are you saying you would've let this destruction be unleashed?"

Tsunade shook her head. "I would've found a way to solve the problem with no bloodshed."

Danzo suddenly looked furious as he shouted, "You stupid woman! Do you truly believe the Uchiha were to be reasoned with? Those power hungry demons would've slaughtered this entire village for their damned pride and you would've just let them do it! I can see it in your eyes! You're a dreamer, one who can't possibly understand the harsh realities of this world!"

Tsunade stared levelly at Danzo and said, "No. You're wrong. I'm not living in a dream. You are living in a haze of distrust and fear. You couldn't possibly understand the bonds that run through this village. The First, the Second, the Third, the Fourth...they all understood those bonds. And so do I."

No one else had time to say anything else. Jiraiya had returned with Sasuke at his side. The three elders realized what Tsunade was thinking and Koharu quickly said, "Tsunade beware what you're about to unleash. Remember the sins of the past. Don't do something you'll regret."

Tsunade smiled coldly and said, "That's sound advice. All those years ago, perhaps you should have heeded it."

With that she turned to Sasuke. Staring him straight in the eye, she explained everything to him. All the details of war, of coups, of his brother, of his entire family, and of Madara as well, she told him all. When she was finished Sasuke was left in shock his entire world view changed in an instant. The shock was slowly replaced with rage. He started growing, filling the council room until he was at his full height of twenty feet. Tsunade had been expecting this. Sasuke charged for the elders, hands outstretched to grab, to hit, to destroy. Instead, he found them grabbed by Tsunade. Using her great strength she managed to hold him in place though it was obviously taking great power.to stop him.

"Sasuke stop! You can't kill them! That is the one punishment that is forbidden! If we were to kill them the balance of the Leaf Village, of the country of Fire, of the other countries and villages could all be disrupted. Distrust and fear could spring up and we could be looked on as dangerous rogues. Instead, I'm allowing you to decide their fate."

It took awhile but eventually Sasuke was back to his normal size, dwelling on a punishment for the elders.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Sasuke's Anger, Sasuke's Choice

choices: The punishment is done
The elders try to escape.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Sasuke was breathing deep as he sat in the elders' chambers. The three elders both feared what he might decide but also felt confident that such a young innocent boy couldn't think of a punishment for them.

"I can not kill them, correct?" Sasuke asked, for the fifth time. Jiraiya looked back from the doors where he was standing guard.

"Again no," Tsunade replied.

"Then I want them stripped of their position in this village. All of them are to be followed by your personal ANBU until they die. And, if possible, I want their spines broken, so they can never walk again," Sasuke said.

"Is that all?" Tsunade asked.

"No, I want them to feel the pain of seeing all your loved ones die and be killed by someone you respect," Sasuke said, his anger returning. "But that would make me no better than this scum. I want them to see not all Uchiha follow that curse. My brother was one of them. And I will be another." Sasuke then stood. "Is the first part acceptable?"

"Yes, I will see to it," Tsunade said.

"Tsunade, you can not be serious?!" Koharu asked. "We have always done what was best for the village."

"What is best and what is right do not always match up," Jiraiya said, "What you did was against the ideals of the First Hokage, your teacher."

"Actually, this punishment is very wise. Your lives will be over. You will never be able to go back," Tsunade said, "If you want, you can always kill yourselves." Tsunade looked at Jiraiya who clapped his hand and a four man team of ANBU appeared.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: The end of their world

choices: Pain uses the confusion of the village to his advantage and attacks
The elders are found but have one more trick up their sleeves
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As the ANBU advanced on the three elders, Homura slowly stood up and said, "This has gone on long enough Tsunade. Did you really think people of our position would have no way of protecting ourselves?"

Before anyone else could anything, before anything could be said, Koharu and Danzo rose and all three started making hand signs. Tsunade didn't know what they were trying to do, but she wasn't about to let them escape. With a curt nod to the ANBU, the elite ninja moved in to apprehend the elders. Before they reached them, a barrier rose around all three. Homura and Danzo turned to escape out the window but Koharu stayed behind. She looked directly at Tsunade and said, "You won't get away with this. What we did needed to be done. There's no denying it no matter how idealistic you may be. We will report this behavior to the Fire Daimyo. Do not be surprised if you are stripped of your title. That may very well prove to be the least of your worries."

With that, the three elders jumped out the window the barrier constricting around them until it surrounded them like a cloak. With a strange shine of chakra the elders disappeared from view. Tsunade turned to the ANBU and said, "I want them found. They are not to leave this village under any circumstances. Send out any available ninja and bring them back for their punishment!"

The ANBU quickly rushed to obey this order. Tsunade turned to Sasuke and said, "I never expected something like this to happen. Don't worry. They will be found and their punishment will be enacted."

Sasuke crossed his arms and said, "What happens if they do get in contact with the Daimyo?"

Jiraiya stepped forward and said, "It's possible that the Daiymo could order a change in the way the village is run. As the ruler of the country where the Leaf village resides we are technically under his laws. We have our own code of laws which we follow but they are subject to be changed at his whim. Normally he lets the village run itself since we're the main military power in the country. But if the elders tell their side of the story Tsunade will be deposed as a dangerous zealot and be replaced. No doubt the elders will have nothing nice to say about me or you either. The entire law of the Leaf village could be changed for the worse."

Tsunade turned to Jiraiya and said, "Then let's not let them escape."

Jiraiya walked to the window and said, "I'll gather any ninja I can find to chase after them. They won't escape."

And so it began. As many ninja as were available patrolled the entire village searching for the invisible elders. Even the ninja that were guarding Itachi's body and the ones guarding the village gates. Finding the elders was given the top priority since if they got out to the Daimyo everything they were currently working on or for could be changed or destroyed. Unfortunately, this left the village very open.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Escape Attempt

choices: Danzo calls on his Root ANBU to aide them, but fail as they can't beat giants
Danzo blows himself up as a distraction  The others don't get far after that
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"In the end, Sabutori wasn't off the mark," Homaru said as the three elders stayed hidden. Though each was old, they had a combined experience to rival the Sannin when they were alive. "He said if the 4th ever found out, we'd probably be killed."

"I fail to see the joke," Danzo said, "Yes, he was off by one Hokage, but our situation isn't that good."

"We need to inform the Daimyo and get this resolved quickly," Koharu said.

"Will that be enough?" Danzo asked.

"What do you mean?" Homaru asked.

"Tsunade may be reckless at times, but she is a very popular person. She's helped unify this village after the invasion and the giant incidents," Danzo said, "Simply removing title won't mean anything if word gets out of what we did. I doubt even the Daimyo will want to fight against Tsunade if she has the giants backing."

"Hmm, those giants could be an issue," Homaru said, as they started moving again. But as soon as they moved, they were surrounded by ten ANBUs, with Kakashi and Hiashi Hyuuga.

"Neji's increased field of vision was very useful here," Kakashi said.

"Yes," Hiashi said, "He was useful."

"You had to mention them," Koharu said. Suddenly Danzo dropped his cane.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Down, but not out

choices: Pain attacks the Leaf Village
Madara has plans of his own
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Danzo turned to the other two and said, "This is our last chance. After this, if we fail to escape we shall accept our punishment with dignity befitting ninja of our position."

He reached into his pocket and pulled out a small rocket. With his other hand he produced a lighter and flicked it open, lighting the fuse and sending the rocket into the sky where it exploded in green sparks. Instantly several shinobi appeared out of nowhere surrounding the other ANBU, Kakashi, and Hiashi. Danzo picked up his cane and shouted, "Root ANBU this is your most important mission to date. Subdue this traitorous group of shinobi and allow us to escape."

The Root ANBU darted forward attacking the group led by Kakashi. As the ANBU attacked the three elders attempted to escape. They didn't get far though. As soon as the Root ANBU had started attacking Kakashi had started growing. The Root ANBU found their attacks all hitting Kakashi and each one doing little to no damage. With a few swift kicks Kakashi was able to subdue the entire group of ANBU. They had been at an extreme disadvantage due to their surprise at Kakashi's monstrous size. With Kakashi able to defeat the Root ANBU, the other ANBU and Hiashi were able to chase after the elders surrounding them once again,forcing them to stop.

Koharu sighed and said, "So this is how it ends."

Hiashi stepped forward and said, "You've brought this upon yourselves. But you will not be killed."

Homura shook his head and said, "We shall be looked upon in disgust for the rest of our lives, confined to chairs as our spines are broken. Our lives are as good as done."

Danzo laughed slightly to himself and said, "Beware. There may come a time when those you counted as friends and allies turn against you and threaten your life. What will you do then I wonder? I hope I live long enough to see it for myself. Nothing in this world is certain. It never was and never will be."

Hiashi had heard enough. With a simple signal the ANBU moved in and rendered the elders unconscious, their bodies falling to the ground. When they awoke they would find their legs dead and unresponsive as Tsunade herself would sever the nerves in their spines. At last the Uchiha had been avenged and Sasuke could live the rest of his life out in peace, free to choose whatever path suited him.

And though there was cause for celebration in Team Seven, the troubles of the Leaf Village were not yet over.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: No Escape From Fate

choices: Konoha refortifies its defenses/Madara takes out Pain's remaining bodies
Konan learns of Madara's betrayal/Team 7 is having a truly enjoyable evening
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Madara sat in a sealed room, wondering what he should do next. If all his years had only taught him one thing it was that one should never leave anything without making insurances. He could tell the time until Pain's attack on him was growing shorter by the second. And Pain's eyes was one of the few things that could harm him. Another was another powerful eternal sharigan.

"It would be far better if Pain defeated Konoha at the cost of his own life," Madara thought, a smile came to his masked face. "And the best way to ensure that would be for Pain's secrets to be known." With this, Madara began his work.

Madara sped through the forests to where he knew he'd find one of Jiraiya's informants. Carefully, as a disguised man from the Rain Village, he spoke of secret information regarding the leader of the Akatsuki, including that he could control two bodies at once at a bar with other shinobi. Jiraiya's informant worked well and by the next day, Jiraiya will of received this crucial information.

"And if Pain does die, I can always wait a few more years for the right moment to corrupt a young Uchiha," Madara thought, smiling once again. Either way, it was win-win for him.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Double Cross

choices: How are things in the future?
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As Pain prepared to set out to attack Konoha, confident in his plans, Madara appeared before him. Pain narrowed his eyes at the Uchiha and said, "What is it Madara?"

Madara advanced on Pain and said, "Well, I've been thinking Pain. This organization as gone downhill as of late. Once it held the attention of the world and it still served my purposes as well as yours. But now that my purposes are no longer being served, I don't believe I want to be a part of this anymore."

Pain turned to stare fully at Madara. He came within inches of Madara's mask and said, "So be it."

Within seconds Madara was surrounded by Pains six bodies, each preparing to attack from a different location. Madara's eye narrowed then blasted back open revealing his Mangekyo Sharingan. Before any of Pain's bodies could attack they were all crushed at the same time by Madara's power. It seemed that even Pain had no idea of the true scope of Madara's eyes. Madara turned his gaze on Pain and said, "Now you and Konan will attack the Leaf village. If you are captured to be interrogated you will tell them you killed me in a coup. If they kill you on sight, then Konan will deliver the message then surrender herself."

As he spoke of Konan his eye glanced in her direction capturing her in his power as well. Pain would've been a better match for Madara if he had known the attack was coming. As it was, all he could do is watch as Madara crushed the last of his organization under his heel. Madara watched as Pain and Konan ran off in a futile attempt to attack the Leaf village. Thanks to Madara they were sure to be killed almost as soon as they were in sight. The giants had no peer.

"But that will eventually turn to their downfall." Madara said to himself as he left the cave that had been the Akatsuki hideout for so long for good. "The next generation is so impressionable."

Madara laughed to himself and disappeared into the afternoon heading for a place of hiding to plot his next move.

Everything went almost exactly as planned. Pain and Konan infiltrated the Leaf village but were quickly spotted and captured. They were interrogated and willingly gave up their information without the need for torture. This was instantly found suspicious by Jiraiya who had come to know the Akatsuki and their ways over the years. He met with Tsunade on top of the Hokage Mansion.

"I don't like the looks of this." He said. "Those two gave up way to easily. And weren't there at least three other members of Akatsuki still alive? Where did they go?"

Tsunade sighed and said, "I suppose it would be foolish to think that the Akatsuki would fall so easily."

"Madara." Jiraiya said simply. "He must be behind all this."

"What could his plan be?" Tsunade said tapping her foot impatiently. "Why would he try this fruitless attack?"

"He wasn't trying to harm the Leaf village. Ibiki told me that Pain said Madara was dead. Judging by the state of Itachi and his words there's no way that Madara would fall so easily. I'm guessing this whole thing was a plan to make us think that Madara and the Akatsuki were all killed so that we'd be lulled into a false sense of security."

Tsunade turned toward her desk and started writing. "Then we'll send out parties to search for him. He won't be able to hide for long."

And so for all intents and purposes the Akatsuki was finished. Other criminals strove to fill the gap left by the powerful organization but no one could really measure up. With the giants patrolling two major portions of the country not many criminals got a chance to rise in power. Night and day Tsunade had ANBU search for Madara or even Madara's corpse but he had disappeared completely. Eventually security decreased around the the village as it entered a period of peace. Relationships developed and fell and new bonds were formed and broken. Thanks to the giants no one in the village felt fear from the outside threats that had once been prominent in their mind.

Yet peace is never absolute. Years later, Madara was planning his next move at last.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: The End? Not Yet...

choices: Start the new day with following Naruto after an S-rank mission with Team 7
Jiraiya and Tsunade talk of old days, and if to tell Sakura how to make them
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Ten years had come since Madara set up Pain's fall. In that time, Konoha had become the strongest of the great five villages, with Suna being right behind. Though the other villages respected the strength, they never gave up trying to find their own growth jutsu to even the playing field. But the only people who knew how to make them, never revealed these secrets. Madara and Tsunade both kept this information to themselves. Both knew how powerful and dangerous this could make even a tiny country. And neither wanted to upset the balance, well Madara didn't want to yet. He was still waiting for the right moment.

During this ten years, Tsunade retired from the position of Hokage once Team Seven had all become jounin. In her replacement, Tsunade chose Kakashi as the next Hokage. With her free time, Tsunade researched the affects the dust had on the giants. And it wasn't until one conceived a child a few years after the end, did she know what else transformed about the giants. Their sexual organs also transformed. In the human reproduction, men will either give an X or Y chromosome to the X egg. When she was examining the fetus of Asuma and Kurenia in Kurenia's womb, she discovered that the child had a different chakra than what it was meant to have. After many tests, she discovered that Asuma's giantism had been encoded on the Y chromosome, so any male born from a giant would inherit his father's burden.

In ten years, Team Seven had become powerful force, near equals to the Sannin, and this was when all were at their smallest heights. Sakura had become Tsunade's rival in terms of beauty and medical ability. Sasuke had advanced to the Mangekyou Sharigan after truly grieving for his brother's death and realizing the lose of a good man it was. Naruto had become a near physical copy of the 4th Hokage, but had still never learned he was his son. He also had created many powerful jutsu, some of which had become forbidden due to their strength.

Itachi's corpse had been preserved and his eyes untouched. Sasuke had refused the eyes when offered to him, still wanting to come to his own power on his own.

In terms of romance, between some, it flourished, while others still required some shoves out the door. It took a few years, but in this day, Temari of the Sand was engaged to Shikamaru of Konoha. The commute between the two villages, but both had earned the permission of their Kages to have the relationship. Gaara was happy his sister found someone to love, and as the Kazekage, he knew this would help the alliance between the villages. Hinata had blossomed into a beauty of her own and gained much confidence when it came to Naruto, but she still hadn't confessed. Ino had come to a similar development. While before she had a young girl's crush on Sasuke, now it was a true deep love. But both girls were ignored by their loves as each man had developed serious feelings for their female teammate. And Sakura had come to give that she cared about each man a great deal, but was still unsure of who she loved more.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Ten years: Somethings change, somethings don't

choices: Follow Sasuke and Naruto as they tail Sakura
Follow someone else's exploits in the village
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
The day was bright, the sun was shining and everyone was in a good mood. It was the kind of day that no one could be mad during or even want to fight. But it was also the perfect conditions for a mission and that is exactly what Team 7 had just finished doing. Ever since becoming jonin, Naruto, Sasuke, and Sakura had been routinely assigned the most difficult missions due to their incredible power individually and especially as a team. Just today they had finished an S rank mission in the Land of Waves. Lately there had been supporters of the Seven Swordsmen of the Mist that had been rising in power ever since Zabuza and Kisame fell. The other Swordsmen had been weeded out their swords used to mark their graves. A few years later seven ninja had rose stealing the swords out of the graves and calling themselves the Second Coming of the Seven Swordsmen. They had dropped the mist moniker since it was comprised of ninja from several different villages. They had started out as a minor nuisance barely worth worrying about. Then they had started becoming more and more bold in their attacks. It was discovered a few months back that they had trained in the ninja arts of those whose swords they held, adding it to their own jutsu mixing styles together on occasion to create attacks never before thought of by shinobi. Finally, it was requested that the Leaf village take care of this threat. Naturally, Kakashi sent out Team 7. After staking out the situation for most of the previous day, the three ninja had attacked the New Seven. Between the three the Swordsman were flummoxed. They managed to pull off a few spectacular moves separately and together forcing Naruto and Sasuke to actually change their sizes. Finally, they had managed to finish them all off. The battle had raged for at least three hours taking quite a bit out of the ninja. It had been a spirited battle and all three were in a good mood.

Naruto was walking slightly ahead of the other two laughing at their victory. "That was the best fight I've had in years!"

Sakura caught up with him and said, "What about that group of thieves we fought ending with an attack by one of Orochimaru's leftover experiments?"

Sasuke walked up to the other side of Naruto and said, "Naruto just doesn't remember that one since he got knocked out before it could really get started."

Sakura laughed as Naruto turned to Sasuke and shouted, "That's not fair! I was cheated out of that fight!"

"Geez, are you always so loud Naruto?" a voice said from behind the three ninja.

Naruto turned and grinned as he saw Shikamaru and Temari walking behind them. "Hey Shikamaru! What's up?"

"Shopping." Shikamaru said in a suffering voice. "For the wedding."

"Oh that's right!" Sakura said. "When is the big day?"

"Two weeks from today." Temari said. "We've already got most of it planned out but there's some last minute things this lazy man was supposed to take care that he didn't."

"Why am I not surprised." Naruto said, smiling at Shikamaru who rolled his eyes.

"Come on, let's just get this over with." Shikamaru said, pulling Temari slightly on her hand. She tightened her grip on his hand and said, "Alright, alright. You're usually not in such a rush..."

As they watched the soon to be newlyweds, Sakura tilted her head and said, "Did Temari seem different to you?"

Naruto shrugged and said, "Different like how?"

"Like she was in a better mood then she normally is. I thought she'd be a little more annoyed that they still had to shop for supplies for the wedding. What do you suppose happened?"

Sasuke said, "Maybe she's pregnant."

Both ninja turned to look at Sasuke in surprise. He looked back and said, "What? It's possible. They may only be getting married now but how long have we seen them together? Who knows how long they were seeing each other."

"Good point." Sakura said. "Anyway, let's go report to Kakashi-sensei."

The three made their way to the Hokage Mansion where Kakashi was sitting in his office, looking over some papers. He looked up when Team 7 walked in and said, "I take it the mission was a success?"

Naruto ran forward and shouted, "Of course it was! What did you think was going to happen Kakashi-sensei?"

Kakashi laughed and said, "Well here's your payment anyway."

He handed Naruto a small stack of money which was then divided between the three ninja. Kakashi watched as the three started leaving, talking amongst themselves. Sakura suddenly stopped and turned back. "Oh, Kakashi-sensei I have a question. Lady Tsunade's been doing research into Asuma and Kurenai's baby right?"

Kakashi nodded. "Why do you ask?"

"Oh...no reason." Sakura said. "Medical curiosity. Where is she right now?"

Kakashi shuffled through some papers and said, "I believe she's relaxing in the Hot Spring today. If you do go and talk to her make sure you don't sneak up on her. Unless you like being punched over 1000 meters away."

Sakura laughed and said, "Thanks Kakashi-sensei. I'll see you guys later."

Sasuke watched Sakura leave before turning to Naruto. "What was that about?"

Naruto, who had already started heading towards Ichiraku for some celebratory ramen, turned back and said, "What's what about?"

Sasuke rolled his eyes and said, "Are you blind Naruto? She's wondering about giant's babies. Doesn't that mean anything to you?"

Naruto thought about it for a minute before his eyes widened. "You don't think she...?"

Sasuke nodded and said, "It's possible."

Naruto narrowed his eyes at Sasuke suspiciously. "You aren't involved in this are you, you pervert?"

Sasuke smacked Naruto in the head and shouted, "Idiot! Why would I bring this up if I was doing something with Sakura?"

"If you don't mind, could you two take this outside?" Kakashi said, staring levelly at the two.

They both left, deciding to follow Sakura to see what she talked to Tsunade about.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Dawn of the New Day

choices: Sakura looks for someone to date
Sasuke and Naruto talk in private when Hinata and Ino appear asking to date them
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
As Sakura walked down the street to the hot spring, she smiled at how much the village had progressed from the help of the giants.

"Those guys have helped so much. Especially Naruto and Sasuke," Sakura thought, "I know Ino and Hinata still like them. But who do I like?" Sakura was so conflicted for a moment, she accidentally bumped into someone.

"Oh, hello Sakura-sama," Iruka said, looking at his old student, as they just bumped shoulders.

"Iruka-sensei, you don't have to use that with my name," Sakura said, "I mean, I was your student first."

"Geese Sakura, don't you know this lunkhead is always the polite one?" Anko asked, as she stood next to Iruka. "By the way, how was your mission yesterday?"

"It went really well," Sakura said, "And Naruto's probably off at the Ichiraku, spending everything he has, again." The couple laughed and went on with their respective walks.

Far behind Sakura, Naruto and Sasuke followed carefully.

"I wonder what she wants to talk to Tsunade about specifically?" Naruto said quietly.

"That's why we're following her dummy," Sasuke said.

Sakura continued on her way, but seeing Iruka with Anko made her move a bit quicker to the hot springs.

"Could that be what's holding me back?" Sakura wondered, "Could knowing what type of child I might have make me so uneasy? I mean a normal fetus is only so big, but if it were to grow inside of me, Sasuke's would be within manageable terms. He just better hope for only one child. If it was Naruto's," Sakura shuddered a little, "I'd be dead before the second trimester." Soon she made it to the hot spring.

"She just shuddered," Naruto said, "She hasn't done that in years."

"This could be serious," Sasuke said.

After asking if Tsunade was there, Sakura went to see her.

"Tsunade-sama," Sakura said from a distance behind the former Hokage, "May I join you?" Tsunade turned around. Her jutsu was still intact and looked like she hadn't aged a day in ten years.

"Sakura, what brings you here?" Tsunade asked.

"Well, I had a big mission yesterday and needed to relax," Sakura said. This was partially true, despite her other desires. Sakura slipped into the hot waters. "So nice."

"I know," Tsunade said.

"By the way, how is little Daiki?" Sakura asked about Asuma and Kurenia's first born son.

"He's much like his grandfather in terms of honor," Tsunade replied, 'Or did you mean his inheritance?"

"That as well," Sakura said in a serious tone, "What effects are their on him from Asuma?"

"Well, as you know, no matter how tall the boy will grow naturally, his giant side is stuck without another scroll," Tsunade said, referring to all boy giants who were now men. None of their maxes increased, despite them gaining a few inches in their shortest form. Sakura nodded. "Daiki was shown to grow to exactly 65 feet maximum. He also couldn't start growing until he had really started using his jutsus. so if you're worried about a giant womb, that will only happen if you have quadruplets or more."

"Who said I was worried about that?" Sakura asked in a panic. Suddenly she looked out at the woods.

"Worried about peepers?" Tsunade asked, "Remember, they put a a mineral in the water so people can't see in. Jiraiya was pissed at that. But as my last law, I had to do something special."

"Yeah," Sakura said, "I guess I'm just worried about my team mates."

"Why?" Tsunade asked, now serious as well.

"I care about both a lot. Both have helped me grow and I've helped them," Sakura said.

"And you don't know who you love more?" Tsunade asked. Sakura nodded.

"And now that I don't have to worry about any child I have killing me, it brings me back to the start of it again," Sakura said. Tsunade sighed.

"Sakura, you don't have to pick one of them, you know," Tsunade said, "Try going out on dates with others as well."

"Yeah, I might try that," Sakura said, "That might help me get my head together. But whose still available?"

"You're asking me?" Tsunade asked before both started laughing.

Elsewhere, on a rooftop, Sasukewas trying to read lips with his sharigan, but to no avail.

"Damn it," Sasuke said, "Every thing's fuzzy over there."

"Man, this sucks," Naruto said.

"It's very stupid to try and peep on the two strongest women in the village," Jiraiya said, appearing.

"Hey Pervy Sage," Naruto said, "But we weren't peeping. We wanted to know what they were talking about."

"Doesn't matter," Jiraiya said, "The steam prevents any vision from entering."

"Then why are you here?" Sasuke asked.

"You can always dream kid. You can always dream," Jiraiya said.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Children who grow; grow big.

choices: Naruto runs into Sakura on his way out.  Awkward moment
Naruto leaves by the back exit, Hinata joins him on a walk.  Sakura sees Neji
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Tsunade rose and said goodbye to Sakura as the young Jounin sat in the waters and thought about possible other guys to date.

"Let's see, Choji's available. But not really my type. Shino's nice, but some of his bugs just creep me out. Kiba is inlove with Hinata, so that would just make things too weird. Whose left?" Sakura thought. Sakura rolled her head and the last two guys her age came to mind. "Lee and Neji. It's been, gosh, six months since Neji and Tenten split up. And from what I heard, it was a mutual agreement that they were better as friends than boyfriend/girlfriend. I wonder if he'd go out with me? Well, only one way to find out." Sakura rose and went to get dressed.

"She's gone," Sasuke said, "Let's get closer and follow her some more."

"Nah," Naruto said.

"You don't want to know what she's up to?" Sasuke asked.

"Is it any of our business? I mean, come on Sasuke, what are we? Two perverted guys who stalk our friend to the spas?" Naruto asked. "You can be it, but leave me out of it." And then Naruto vanished just as Sakura left the main room and was on the road again.

Elsewhere, at the Hyuuga Manor, both Neji and Hinata were hard at work. The jounin Neji was training the chunin Hinata and Hanabi at the same time. Today, they were sparing against the other. Hinata had come a long way in terms of her Byakugan skill. Hanabi was equally gifted. Suddenly there was a knock at the door.

"I'll be right back, take a break you two," Neji said, leaving for the main door. Hinata and Hanabi were worn out today from the workout.

"You're getting better Sister," Hanabi said, "Maybe Naruto will finally notice you."

"And maybe Lee will notice you," Hinata shot back quickly. Both girls stared at each other and then looked away. Hinata was happy when she found out about her sister's crush on Rock Lee. Using it usually shut her up, as it wasn't as well known as her own interests.

Neji opened the door. "Oh, what are you doing here?" Neji asked his visitor.

"Hey Neji, I came to see you," Naruto said, "I have a question that I think you can help me with. May I come in?"

"Sure," Neji said. Neji was confused. Rarely did Naruto ever come to the Hyuuga manor. Even more rare was when Naruto and Neji had a talk that wasn't about a recent mission. A talk about a private nature was unheard of. "This way to my quarters," Neji said, leading Naruto. As they passed the sparring ring, Neji called out, "We're done for today. Get some rest." His cousins looked up and saw Naruto walk by with Neji.

"Naruto? What's he doing here?" Hinata said quietly.

"Maybe he wants to ask Father's permission to date you?" Hanabi chided. Hinata could only wonder.

Naruto now sat in Neji's living room. He was waiting for Neji to bring some tea in.

"Now, what did you want to talk about?" Neji asked.

"I wanted to know how your relationship with Tenten affected your missions," Naruto said, "And you with Lee."

"I see," Neji said, "Well, when we were dating, I had to put my relationship on the back burner when I was on a mission. And with Lee, at first it was difficult. But eventually, we got to a status quo. He must of felt like a third wheel sometimes. But he never showed it."

"I see," Naruto said, sipping the tea before him.

"This wouldn't have to do with you and Sasuke liking Sakura, would it?" Neji asked.

"Yeah, it does," Naruto said, "I don't want to pressure Sakura, but I don't want to lose to Sasuke here either."

"Would it really be a lose if Sakura was the one who wanted him? If you wanted Sakura's happiness above all, wouldn't that be more important than an age old pissing contest with Sasuke?" Neji asked.

"You're right, Neji. Thanks," Naruto said.

"You're welcome. Guy told Lee and me the same thing a few years ago about Tenten," Neji said.

"I might have to use them on Sasuke as well," Naruto said, laughing as he stood up. "Thanks a lot Neji. I'll see you around." Naruto walked and let himself out.

Outside the doors of the Hyuuga Manor, Sakura stood and knocked.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Unexpected Company

choices: Naruto and Hinata go out on their date
Sakura talks to Sasuke...
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
Naruto had decided to leave by the back exit of the Hyuga Manor since he would end up closer to his house anyway. As he walked away down the street to his house Hinata slowly walked up behind him her heart pounding. She had followed after she had heard Naruto leave with Hanabi giggling behind her. She had ignored her sister's snickering knowing this was as good a time as any to maker her feelings to Naruto completely known. She would lead him to asking her out on a date and see how things went from there. She followed him for a few minutes hiding behind bushes, fences, and trees until she finally worked up all the courage she could and ran out toward Naruto saying, "Naruto! Wait!"

Naruto turned around and smiled when he saw Hinata coming towards him. "Oh hey Hinata!"

Naruto had finally stopped thinking of Hinata as a creepy girl who constantly fidgeted in front of him and always acted really uncomfortable. He had been beginning to think Hinata was afraid of him or something. Luckily she had loosened up around him. She was smiling at him as she caught up and asked, "Can I walk with you Naruto?"

Naruto looked surprised at first and Hinata's heart sank. Then he smiled at her and said, "Sure!"

They walked on in silence for a few minutes before Hinata said, "How have your missions been going Naruto?"

Naruto grinned and said, "Great! Kakashi-sensei's been giving us some really good ones! How about you?"

"Oh, well I've been getting by." Hinata said. She didn't want Naruto to think she didn't do anything exciting or that she was shying away from tough missions.Being a Chunin she didn't get as many tough missions as Naruto was getting as a Jonin.She got closer to Naruto and said, "So what are you doing tomorrow Naruto?"

Naruto thought about it and said, "Well...as long as Kakashi-sensei doesn't saddle us with any missions I'm not really doing anything. Why? Oh! Do you want to do something tomorrow?"

Hinata could've sung with happiness! She smiled and said, "Sure! That would be wonderful!"

As Hinata and Naruto walked to Naruto's house, Sakura was waiting anxiously by the door of the Hyuga Manor. She was nervous since she didn't know how Neji would take to the idea of dating her. She wasn't even sure whether or not she wanted to date him.

"But I have to keep my options open." Sakura told herself sternly. "Naruto and Sasuke aren't exactly undesirables. There could be a chance that both of them already have their eyes on someone."

As Sakura ruminated the door opened and Neji appeared surprised to see her. Sakura smiled and said, "Hello Neji. Can I come in?"

Neji nodded and said, "You know, Naruto came by just a few minutes ago to talk to me."

Sakura looked shocked and said, "Really? W-what did you talk about?"

"It seems he was worried that relationships between squad members could cause the bonds they shared to break." Neji said, showing Sakura into the same room he had talked with Naruto in.

"Really..." Sakura said quietly sitting down.

"It seems that he has his eye on someone on his team." Neji said. "But he's willing to put these feelings aside if it means the happiness of the person he loves."

Sakura could almost feel tears welling up in her eyes. To think that Naruto cared that much about her feelings that he'd step aside and let her be with Sasuke if that's what she wanted. Neji handed her a handkerchief and she blew her nose on it. He smiled at her and said, "I think I've answered any questions you may have needed to ask."

Sakura sniffed and said, "Oh no, I was wondering something completely different. Now I'm not so sure I should ask but...would you ever consider going out with me?"

Neji considered Sakura's question. He knew she probably was only looking for a little security but he had never really considered going out with Sakura before. He had looked at her over the years as a capable shinobi but his feelings had never developed beyond that. Now that he thought about it...

He looked her in the eye and said, "Yes I would Sakura. If things don't work out with Sasuke or Naruto I would be willing to go out with you. However, I'm not going to wait around while you decide whether or not you have feelings for your squad mates. I have a life of my own after all."

Sakura looked a little embarrassed as she said, "I never expected you to. Anyway thanks for talking with me Neji. It really helped."

Neji showed Sakura out and watched as she walked out of sight. Things could get very interesting around here...
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Advice from Neji and Hinata's Chance

choices: Suddenly, they see Hinata and Naruto walk by
Ino over hears part of their talk, not knowing it was a what if situation
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
About an hour or so earlier. Sasuke stood as Naruto vanished.

"What's he talking about? Calling me perverted? And he created the Giantess-Harem Jutsu," Sasuke thought, as he turned his gaze back to Sakura as she left the spa. He watched as the girl he loved walked on, but Naruto's words rung in his head. Sasuke growled and didn't follow Sakura. "I hate it when he gives those speeches," Sasuke said, "He actually says intelligent stuff." He then vanished and wandered around for some time, thinking on what Sakura might of been doing.

Some time later, Sakura's call at him made him look up.

"Sasuke," Sakura called, "Where have you been?" She walked up in front of him and looked up into his eyes.

"Oh, I was just wandering around," Sasuke said.

"So, you're not doing anything?" Sakura asked.

"No. Why?" Sasuke replied.

"Well, do you want to get some tea?" Sakura asked, "My treat."

"Sure," Sasuke said, smiling. The two went to a little shop and sat down. As they waited for the tea, Sakura looked at Sasuke with a warm smile. But there was more to this smiling face than the smile it self. Sakura was studying Sasuke's face for any unconscious action he might give in response to what she had planned. But this act was well hidden that Sasuke didn't even notice it. The tea came and both sipped.

"Sasuke," Sakura said, "May I ask you a hypothetical question?" Sasuke blinked.

"Sure," Sasuke replied. He had an uncomfortable feeling in his gut, but dismissed it.

"Let's say, you liked Ino a lot. So much, you wanted to date and even marry her, okay?" Sakura asked.

"All right," Sasuke said, "Are you jealous of this desire of mine?"

"No, I'd be happy for you. But what if Ino and Choji decided to go out. What would you feel?" Sakura asked. Sasuke blinked. His mind was quickly putting the "what if" to reality. Sakura was Ino and Choji was probably either Naruto or himself. The unknown was what the point of this idea was.

"I would feel sad," Sasuke said, "Sad that I let something slip though my fingers."

"What do you mean?" Sakura asked.

"Well, even if I didn't feel that way about Ino at first, she liked me before Choji. For me to let that go, I'd feel stupid. I'd probably wait and see if things didn't work out, especially if things went south," Sasuke said.

"You mean, you'd be a shoulder to cry on and help her get back with Choji if she really wanted it?" Sakura asked.

"Yes, I may not like doing something like that, but then again, this is all hypothetical, so who knows how I'd act," Sasuke said.
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.title: Sasuke's feelings

choices: Fastforward to the two dates, during them, Sakura finds out about them
At a meeting of team 7 the next day, Sakura finds out about the two dates
1121221112121111122211211121212111212121.content:
"I see," Sakura said, "That's a good point. We have learned a couple times things don't always go as planned. So who knows what might happen." Sasuke nodded as he looked back at Sakura. He tried to control his body as much as possible, guessing she was reading him. It didn't help that she had become friendly with Ibiki Morino, while studying under Tsunade. As a result, she picked up a few interrogation tips neither Naruto or he knew. Out of his team, he would have to note that Sakura could be, at times, more dangerous and deadly than the others.

"So, what would you like to do now?" Sasuke asked, finishing his tea.

"Well, I need to do some shopping," Sakura said.

"All right, I'll see you later," Sasuke said, smiling a little. Suddenly he looked out the window. "Hey Hinata and Naruto are walking together," Sasuke said. Sakura turned to the window. Through the glass window, she saw Naruto talking to Hinata about something and Hinata was laughing and blushing.

"Good for them," Sakura said, sweetly. It was for only a brief moment, but she felt a sting seeing them together so casually. Luckily, for her, Sasuke didn't notice the act. "Well, by Sasuke," Sakura said. Sasuke nodded.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----

As Hinata and Naruto walked past the tea shop, he was telling her about the time he invented the Giantess-Harem jutsu.

"Yeah, so when I made it, I had just used it to get Sasuke to blink. It was an old game we had to see who would first," Naruto said. "I first tried my standard Sexy Jutsu. But unfortunately he was wasn't fazed. He then tried a fireball jutsu on me. He told me only a powerful attack would work, not some stupid little girl. I came out of the transformation and grinned." Naruto paused for dramatic effect.

"What did you do next?" Hinata asked.

"I created 20 shadow clones all around him and transformed used the Harem jutsu. He was weakened, but really blinked when all the clones grew and smothered him," Naruto said, laughing, "He wouldn't speak to me for a week." Hinata laughed as well. She didn't find the story that funny, but enjoyed Naruto speaking so casually. She also blushed slightly thinking on what that image must of been for Sasuke.

"So, did anything happen next?" Hinata asked.

"Well, Sakura beat me up for making another perverted jutsu," Naruto said, "And my attack helped Jiraiya to write his next Icha Icha book." Naruto stopped. "Hey, I wonder if Kakashi promoted me to chunnin for helping with that book?" Naruto said quietly.

Are you serious?" Hinata asked.

"Nope," Naruto said, "Just playing with you." Hinata's blush went deeper.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

As Sasuke wandered the streets back to his home, he thought on what happened with Sakura. It took him by no surprise she wanted to know how starting a relationship with either him or Naruto would affect the team. She always one to want to know everything before making a move.

"There it is again," Sasuke thought sensing someone watching him. He turned and decided to call them out on the deserted street. "Hey, come on out," Sasuke said.

Ino felt worried when Sasuke called her out. In ten years, Ino had become a a striking beauty. Her face and body could rival both Hinata and Sakura's. Now a Chunnin, she served mainly as a teacher at the Academy.
